loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Elizabeth O., a 53-year-old single woman with four children in school, has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana.  She sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc. at her market location. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in order to further develop her business,  planning to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says that she would be grateful for your assistance. Elizabeth is a member of the group called Divine, whose members agree to guarantee and support one another in the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Gumercinda Elvira

texts.es:
Gumercinda tiene con 43 años de edad, es viuda, madre de tres hijos, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 189, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Al principio con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayeta y lana para su negocio de bordadura. A los 20 años de edad empezó a confeccionar artesanías que vendía en Juli. Cuando tuvo su esposo dejó el negocio para dedicarse a su casa y después de casi unos 10 años su esposo falleció. Hoy continúa trabajando con el negocio de bordados para sacar adelante con sus hijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará lana de alpaca (11kg a S/.135) y lana de varios colores.
 
Su mayor deseo es exportar sus productos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 43 years old, is widowed and is the mother of 3 children. She studied through the 5th year of secondary school, and lives at 189 Jr. Alfonoso Ugarte, in the district of Juli, in the province of Chuchito, in the province of Puno. Gumercina is one of the founding members of the community bank "St. Savior Child" of Juli. With the first loan of 300 soles, Gumercinda purchased cloth and wool for her embroidery business. When she turned 20, she began to make crafts and sold them in Juli. When she got married, she closed her business to make time to take care of the house, but after almost 10 years her husband passed away. Today Gumercinda continues working in the embroidery business to support her children. With this 500 soles loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase alpaca wool (11 kg for 0.135 soles) and wool of various colors. Her greatest desire is to export her products to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. She weaves rugs and tapestries, which she then sells in the F. Vivanco market in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells cheese on occasion. 

Roxana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (US $350) to buy two new looms for her workshop. 

Roxana has been a FINCA client for more than two years. She left for a time, but decided to return because FINCA gives her access to investment capital and helps her save money. “I left, and I felt like I didn’t have anything,” she says. “Here, I feel like I have something.” 

Roxana goal for the future is to increase her workshop’s production capacity by buying more looms.

loans.use: Buy two looms

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Hy M., 26, is a rice farmer and also raises pigs to sell. She raises them for three or four months prior to slaughter. She is married with two children, both of whom are teenagers and in priM. school. Her husband, Mr. Bun Chanthoeurn, is a rice farmer and has a mill for a rice grinding business. Because raising pigs and milling rice are their main income, M. would like to request a loan to purchase pig food and to purchase rice stocks to keep and resell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and to purchase rice stocks to keep and resell for profit

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is blessed with a child and is a resident of Recto St., 50th District, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. As a single parent, she is determined to raise her only daughter, who is kindergarten school, appropriately. 


She has a "sari-sari" store, and the capital that she put up from the start was only PHP 1,000 that she got from her aunt. Her sari-sari store is located near a school at Ozamiz City. She cannot meet the demand of her customers because the goods and supplies that she has are not enough. 


She needs PHP 5,000 additional capital to purchase goods and supplies needed in her sari-sari store. And someday if she gets lucky in business she will purchase a photocopy machine for added income.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Ozamis-Recto St.- 50th District, Ozamiz City, Misa

loans.name: Bazar

texts.en:
A. Bazar is a 38-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children. All of his children go to elementary school. He sells beef and sheep meat at the "Huchit shonhor" food market. He buys whole animals once a day from the wholeseller and then sells individual cuts of meat. A. lives in the ger (mongolian nomadic housing similar to a yurt).

Currently he is building a house in his yard which is about 90% completed. His wife helps him by selling meat at the market stall during the summer. In the winter time she takes care of her children at home. Their dream is to complete their house and leave it for their children. After A. turns 50 he would like to move to the country with his wife and start a farm. The picture is of A. in one of XacBank's branches. XacBank is one of Kiva's MFI partners from Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy beef and sheep meats

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalem Group

texts.es:
el grupo nueva jerusalem este integrado de la siguiente forma:
la Sra. Felipa M. tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijas las cuales estan estudiando en el instituto Tecnico Sierra de Nacaome. ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y quesillo, ella tiene su negocio hace 4 años, vive en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, cuando las hijas tienen ratos libres le ayudan a producir las tortillas y tambien a venderlas ya que se desplazan a vender las tortillas en la comunidad que viven. el sueño de la Sra. M. es graduar a sus dos hijas de la Universidad.
La joven Dixcy P.  tiene dos años de tener su pulperia ya que le gusta bastante las ventas fue que ella decidio poner este negocio tambien vende golosinas, ella le ayuda a su madre economicamente su sueño es estudiar en la universidad y poder poner un supermercado.
La Sra. Rosa Amelia V. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar tienen dos hijos los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela comunal.
ella vende leña y ropa desde hace 10 años y tiene bastantes clientes su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Nueva Jerusalem Group is made up of the following people:

Ms. Felipa M. is 51 years old. She is single and has two children who are studying at the Technical Institute of the Mountans of Nacome. She sells tortillas and quesillo, a soft creamy cheese. She has had her business for four years. She lives in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood. When her children have free time, they help her to make and sell the tortillas, since they moved to their neighborhood to sell tortillas. Ms. M.’s dream is that her children will graduate from college.

Dixcy P. is a young woman and has had a small grocery store for two years. She really enjoys being in sales and decided to also sell candies. Ms. P. helps her mother with her expenses. Her dream is to study in a university and to own a supermarket.

Ms. Rosa Amelia V. is 34 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children who are studying in school. She has sold firewood and clothes for 10 years and has many customers. Her biggest dream is that her children will be professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, firewood, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, bread, coffee, shirts, pants, shorts, underwear, boxers, brassieres.

loans.name: Azra M. Hussain Group

texts.en:
'My name is Azra and I’m a 39-year-old married lady. I have been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 16 years. My husband's name is M. H.. He works in a factory for a monthly wage. I am a mother of seven kids: four daughters and three sons. My first three daughters prepare embroidered dresses. My elder son is involved in a dairy business. The others are getting education from a local school. I help my daughters in preparing embroidered clothes. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand my sons’ dairy business.'

Azra is the group leader of six other women from her locality. Razia baji and Qubra baji each want a loan to buy iron to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Azran baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her son's dairy business

loans.name: Jay-Ar

texts.en: Jay-ar B. is a 21-year-old young entrepreneur and is married to Haidee. They have a child and live in the village of Andarayan, Solana, Cagayan. The young couple is striving hard to improve the future of their family. Jay-ar is engaged in poultry-raising, where he sells chickens after they complete 45 days. Aside from this, he also vends meat and fish in his village. His business has been of great help in providing for his family’s needs. He is also a very responsible father. He requests a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve his business. He believes that through hard work and financial assistance, he will be able to improve his business and save for the future of his family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia N. is a resident of Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 36 and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and his work is their main source of income but is not enough for them. She joined Paglaum MPC  to acquire start-up capital in the amount of Php 12,000 for her fish-selling business. As per records, she has been a trusted borrower of PAGLAUM.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish every day for retail purposes

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelaida A., 48 years old, is married and a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is blessed with seven children: one is now having a family, two are now working and the rest are still dependent on her. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time does fishing activity at night and at times when he is free from carpentry work.

To help support her big family, Mrs. A. engage in salted pry vending locally known as “Oyap”. She inherited this kind of business from her parents. They deliver their goods to the neighboring towns and cities here like Ozamiz, Oroquieta and even Pagadian City. As a 4th cycle loaner of the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC, she is applying for P5,000 to add to her capital for purchasing pry in order to meet the demands of her loyal customers.

Her hope and aspiration is to give her children a better education for a better future. She is also thankful that she learned how to use money wisely from the education she received from PMPC.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for "Oyap" vending

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Ever since Mary was a young girl she has loved to sing. In 2005 she began studying music and eventually released a single in 2006. With a full length Gospel CD in 2007 her hobby turned into a business.  Mary writes and performs Christian Gospel Swahili music in South Boston where she has close ties to the African community. Mary sells her music through concerts as well as her website.

Mary has recently received a second loan from ACCION USA to finish producing a series of music videos.  She hopes to break into the large market in East Africa where videos, and not music albums, generate revenue and reach more listeners.  

She hopes to reach millions of Swahili speakers in countries like Kenya, Burundi, Tanzania and Uganda.  In addition, she recently noticed that there’s a big market in the United States for her music, that goes beyond the African communities with whom she has close ties.  Mary says many people who buy her CD don’t speak Swahili, “but they like the beat.”  She currently performs all over Boston and has also performs at large community benefits and fundraisers.

loans.use: Music video production

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: El próximo mes Teodora cumplirá 38 años, actualmente vive con el padre de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, la cual está hecha a base de madera y han cubierto por dentro con plástico para evitar que se penetre el frió de la noche. De pequeña apoyaba a sus padres en los trabajos agrícolas y lo que más le gustaba era cultivar las plantitas de plátano, ya que es un producto que no necesita de mucho esfuerzo y le permitía cosechar semanalmente. Todos los viernes se dedicaba a cosechar y a encajonar los plátanos para su fácil transporte y cada sábado los comercializaba en el mercado, las ganancias de este trabajo le permitieron cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Pero desde hace 2 años optó por  dedicarse mayormente a la compra y venta de frutas, desde entonces compra su mercadería directamente de las chacras de los agricultores, con esta modalidad gana mucho más a pesar de tener que pagar el transporte. Teodora está muy contenta con su negocio, ahora tiene mucha más clientela y esto le genera mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, durante los 2 periodos anteriores demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas. Sus compañeros de banco comunal la llaman “la suavecita”, ya que tiene un trato muy sutil e irradia tranquilidad en sus conversaciones. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en el incremento del capital para su negocio de compra y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Teodora will be 38 years old next month. She lives with the father of her 4 children in a house they own, a house constructed of wood and covered on the inside by plastic to keep out the cold night air. She used to help her parents with farm work as a young girl and what she most liked was growing plantains because they don't require a lot of effort and they can be harvested twice a year. She used to pick and box the plantains on Fridays so they could be transported easily and, on Saturdays, she took them to the market to sell. The earnings from this work allowed her to pay for her children's schooling. Two years ago, though, she decided to spend the majority of her time buying and selling fruit. Since then, she's bought her merchandise directly from local farmers, something that's allowed her to earn more even though she has to pay transportation costs. Teodora is very happy with her business. She now has many more customers, her business generates more revenue and she's been able to improve her quality of life. This is her third MFP loan. She repaid the installments on the previous two loans on time. The other members of her community bank call her La Suavecita, "The Gentlewoman", because her manner of conversation is so subtle and serene. The loan will be used to increase capital for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en:
F. Abdukhalil is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. His wife works as a teacher in the local school. For many years, Abdukhalil has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his farm and the "good morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day. He rises before sunrise and, with love and hope, he works the field that generate his family's income. Abdukhalil is applying for a loan of $1000 USD to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including seeds and fertilizer. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated many hours of work during many months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard O. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He sells provisions and drinks and he is also taxi driver. He is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Afi Cathérine

texts.fr: Afi Cathérine est née vers 1982. Cathérine est mariée et mère de deux enfants. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Cathérine vend des sacs de maïs au marché de Cocotomey. C’est à Parakou au Nord du Bénin et à Adja dans le Département du Mono que Cathérine achète ses produits. Cathérine a déjà eu de prêt de la part d’ALIDé ; prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Cathérine sollicite encore de prêt d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître le volume de ses produits pour le bonheur de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Afi Cathérine was born around 1982.  She is married and the mother of two children.  The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou,  the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She sells sacks of corn at the Cocotomey marketplace.  Parakou in northern Benin, and Adja in Mono County, are where she buys her goods.  Cathérine has already had a loan from ALIDé that she has repaid.  She is requesting an ALIDé loan again to boost her working capital and to increase her merchandise volume for the happiness of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 40 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Pedro, de 44 años, y sus 4 hijos: Nelson de 20, Marco de 15, Wilmer de 13 y Sarai de 4 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su taller de tejidos artesanales se encuentra en su propia casa, ella realiza los tejidos en compañía de dos trabajadores que le ayudan diariamente, con los cuales puede cumplir los grandes pedidos que le hacen. Pero también tiene un puesto de venta, el cual está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y conversar con sus ayudantes sobre los modelos que pueden realizar para mejorar la venta, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los enormes fardos de tejidos artesanales hasta su puesto de venta y a los puestos donde los que distribuye. Para el futuro espera tener su propia tienda de ropa donde pueda vender exclusivamente lo que confecciona. Este es el primer préstamo de Inés y está dispuesta a pagarlo por completo, para acceder a uno nuevo y confía plenamente en las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos y así incrementar el stock de su puesto.

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Raymone

texts.en: Raymonde is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. She has owned a clothes shop called "Maguy" since 2000 to earn income to cooperate her husband in the household. Today, Raymonde is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more clothes for her shop, and to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan de la cruz C. P., tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras , ellos tienen nueve hijos , todos ya casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 30 años don Juan se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , ya que su mamá le dio tierras para que las trabajara y apoyara a su familia , él esta agradecido por la oportunidad que le hemos brindado durante nueve crédito ya que no solo ha mejorado sus cultivos si no también las condiciones de vida , ya que le ha permitido pagar en tiempo y formas sus préstamos a la vez le ha permitido que sus hijos trabajen con él. Con este préstamo comprara los insumos necesarios y poder aplicar al cultivo para lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan de la Cruz C. P. is 50 years-old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works as a fruit and vegetable merchant. Together they have nine children, who are all married and independent now. Juan's plan for his family is to improve their conditions of living. For 30 years Juan has worked in the farming business and his mother gave him lands for him to work and support his family. He is grateful for the opportunity we have given him with the nine loans he has received as they have not only allowed him to improve his crops but also his living conditions. His success with the loans has allowed him to pay on time and at the same time to work with his children. With this loan he will buy the supplies necessary to succeed in bringing in a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies and their application

loans.name: Maritza Jaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Sánchez Véles es socia del Banco Comunal Everes ubicado  en la comunidad de Palo  Quemado en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Maritza tiene 36 años está casada con Manuel desde hace 21 años y tienen  cinco hijos de 20, 16, 12, 11, 7 años, vive en casa de sus suegros.

Maritza se dedica a la compra y venta de maní para lo cual  ha tenido que arrendar un terreno de dos cuadras para sembrar este producto cada cuatro meses para luego cosechar y vender, ella trabaja con su esposo y da empleo a  dos personas de su comunidad que se encargan de sembrar.

Una vez cosechado el maní pasa al  proceso de tostar y moler para  venderlo  por libras en las tiendas de su comunidad actividad que la realiza Martiza, ya que ella argumenta que el trabajo debe ser compartido.

Con el préstamo  que le entregue la fundación ESPOIR   invertirá  en la compra de  maní para sembrar en los próximos meses de invierno y tratar de mejorar su producción y dar empleo a más personas.

Maritza al igual que muchas socias también tiene un sueño y es precisamente estudiar una carrera agrícola para mejorar sus técnicas de producción de maní, así como  otras alternativas de productos de ciclo corto, además considera que nada es imposible mientras uno tenga las ganas y el deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Maritza Sánchez Véles is a member of the Everes Communal Bank located in the Palo Quemado community in the province of Manabí. It is a peaceful agricultural community. She has been married to Manuel for 21 years and they have five children, aged 20, 16, 12, 11, and 7. They live in Manuel’s parents’ house.

Maritza is in the peanut business. She rents land to plant a crop every four months. She works with her husband and also hires two others from the community for planting. Once harvested, the peanuts are roasted and ground, and then sold by the pound in local stores. Maritza believes that this part of the work should be shared.

With this loan from ESPOIR, Maritza will purchase seed peanuts to plant in the coming winter months. She will try to increase production and employ more people.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seed peanuts to increase production and employ more people

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia M. is divorced and has three children. She has received a junior high school education. Cecilia sells clothing, cosmetics and bread near Shama Junction as a hawker, which she has been doing since 1999. Cecilia uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Cecilia will use the loan to buy clothing and cosmetics to improve her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Buy clothing and cosmetics to improve her business.

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: La señora Norma Aracely Pérez es casada y madre de familia de 2 niños, su papa vive con ellos y todos apoyan para los gastos del hogar, son una familia muy unida. Su esposo labora para una empresa desde hace 3 años y la señora Norma Aracely tiene su negocio propio de venta de ropa usada establecido desde hace 2 años, el cual esta creciendo ya que cuenta con buen producto para su clientela, por tal motivo esta tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma Aracely Pérez is married and the mother of two children. Their father lives with them and all contribute to meet household expenses; they are a very united family. Her husband has been employed by a company for the last 3 years and Norma Aracely has had her own business selling second-hand clothing for the last 2 years. Her business has been steadily growing because she has good quality product for her customers. This is the reason behind her request for funds: to buy more merchandise to add to her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Adriana Lucila

texts.es: Doña Adriana Lucia su venta es la ropa variada para dama, caballeros y niños, trabaja con clientes que le compran al contado y muchas veces da al crédito de la quincena. Su esposo es mecánico y trabaja por cuenta propia pero muchas veces los trabajos están malos lo que le preocupaba que su esposo no tiene un salario fijo. Por eso comienza con su venta de ropa dinero que el de da para comenzar su venta y así poder ayudar con la alimentación como pago de agua y luz. Tiene 37 años de edad, procreo tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian ya que el mayor se caso, sus planes es poder crecer en su negocio y poder apoyar a sus hijos para que terminen su ciclo de estudio. Con este préstamo lo que quiere hacer es un portón  principal en la entrada de la casa lo cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la obra. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer posible esta mejora.
texts.en:
Adriana sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children. She works with customers who buy from her with cash or, many times, she gives two-weeks credit. Her husband is a mechanic and works on his own account but often, jobs are poor and this is worrisome, since he lacks a fixed salary. That's why she began to sell clothes, using money he provided to start her business. And thus she can help pay for food, water, and lights.

Adriana is 37 years old and has 3 children, 2 of whom are studying and one has married. Her hope is to be able to continue expanding her business and help her children to complete their schooling.

With this loan she wants to install a new doorway in the entrance to her house, buying rocks, sand, cement, and iron in order to commence the work. She thanks her banking institution for the opportunity to make this improvement possible.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ROCKS, SAND, CEMENT, AND IRON TO BUILD AN ENTRY DOORWAY IN HER HOUSE

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has a grown daughter, Anastasia. She lives and works in Melitopol. Yelena owns a well-equipped vending kiosk in one of the local marketplaces where she sells men’s outer wear. She has been working in this sphere of trade for 12 years. Currently, she has 100,000 Grivnyas in stock. Her monthly net profit is about 9,000 Grivnyas. 

Yelena is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise. She is hoping to continue developing her business. Yelena is planning to use the generated profit to do some remodeling in her apartment and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth S., 32, sells food for construction workers in the city and is able to earn $2 US per day to help cover the family expenses. She is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been in her business since 1993. Her husband is a construction foreman earning $13 US per day.  

S. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more wood for her husband to build houses for his customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy wood to build houses for customers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. O. is thirty-eight years old, widowed, and has three children who are all in school. Her business is located at Kondele in Kisumu, a lakeside city in Kenya. Her business is situated along the Kondele-Kibos road within a residential area and it is well known by the name of Maroon Enterprise.

Rosemary is involved in selling timber and poles to individual developers in Kisumu and institutions as well. She also has a hardware store where she sells nails and timber, and she provides transport services. Her major challenge is theft of timber from the yard and police harrassment due to illegal logging. She is using her loan to add to her stock of timber. In future, she hopes to grow her business and open a carpentry shop at the timber yard. She is very hard-working, reliable, polite, and jovial.

loans.use: Timber

loans.name: Nida's Group

texts.en:
Nida F. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Nida is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El  Señor Eduardo L. V., tiene 58 años y está casada con la señora Lidia Martha Pinto de L.  por más de 25 años, La esposa tiene una  tienda de abarrotes que vende diariamente en el pueblo de colomi, el esposo se dedica a la producción de tubérculos , hortalizaslos  los productos son vendidos en la fría de colomi. Los insumos agrícolas que utiliza para la siembra de tubérculos y hortalizas son  abono orgánico de gallinaza, semilla de papa certificada que son adquiridos de las tiendas que venden los insumos agrícolas.

El señor Eduardo L.  y su familia  viven en el pueblo de colomi  la actividad principal es la agricultura que realiza en la comunidad de liriuni. Para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo, el Cidre  está en la zona de colomi que  para ellos es más fácil  solicitar un crédito  para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesitan para la siembra.

El mayor sueño de don Eduardo y su esposa Lidia, es sacar profesionales a sus tres hijos, el mayor  tiene 18 años, el que sigue 16 años y el ultimo 14 años, para ellos necesita ampliar mas la producción agrícolas  y tener ingresos suficientes que pueden cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Eduardo L. V., 58, has been married to Lidia Martha Pinto de L. for over 25 years. The wife has a grocery store that she tends to daily in the town of Colomi; the husband is a farmer. He sells his products in Colomi's market. The farming suppies he needs for his tuber and vegetable crops are: organic hen dung manure and certified potato seed. These are available in farming supply stores. Eduardo L. and his family live in the town of Colomi; his main activity is farming, which he does in the community of Liriuni. It is difficult for them to access bank loans. Cidre, however, is in Colomi and it is easier for them to ask for funds for the farming supplies they need for their crops. Eduardo and Lidia's greatest dream is to have their three children become professionals. The oldest is 18, the next one is 16 and the youngest is 14 years old. He needs to increase his agricultural production for them in order to have sufficient income to cover educational expenses for his three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos vive en la zona de alto san antonio en la parte periferica de la ciudad de la paz. Él esta casado con julia y juntos tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. El Sr. Carlos tiene una movilidad con la que trabaja como taxista. Él es una persona muy alegre y responsable con su familia y su trabajo ya que cada día se despierta muy temprano en la mañana y sale a trabajar con su taxi y se queda trabajando hasta muy tarde en la noche. Carlos llegó a nuestra institución hace varios años atrás y desde ese momento demostró ser responsable con sus pagos. Los créditos que sacó anteriormente los utilizó para ayudar a su esposa a poder abrir una venta de comida y de esa manera el y su esposa pueden aportar juntos para los ingresos de la casa. Unos de sus mas grandes deseos es poder ver a sus hijos profesionales. Ahora carlos quiere hacer unas reparaciones en su taxi y es por eso que solicita el préstamo.
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the area of upper San Antonio in the part peripheral to the city of La Paz. He is married to a woman named Julia and together they have two school-aged children. Carlos works as a taxi driver. He is a very happy person and very responsible about his family and his job. Every day he wakes up very early in the morning to leave for work with his taxi and he works until very late in the night.

Carlos came to our institution several years ago and from that moment he has demonstrated that he is very responsible for his payments. The loans that he has taken out earlier were used to help his wife open a food store which allows her to help with the household income. One of their biggest dreams is for their children to become professionals. Now Carlos is asking for a loan to repair his taxicab.

He is very grateful to Emprender and Kive for their trust in giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Agustin Haroldo

texts.es: Agustín es de 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, junto con su esposa han establecido un talles de fabricación de sandalias los comercializa en el mercado local, es el tercer crédito que solicita en ASDIR los anteriores los pago bien, acude nuevamente para adquirir un financiamiento que le servirá para ampliar su capital específicamente para la compra de materiales que se utiliza en la fabricación de las sandalias.
texts.en:
Agustín is 36 years old, married, and has four children (two sons and two daughters). Together with his wife, he established a workshop where they manufacture sandals to sell at the local market. This is the third loan he has requested from Asociación ASDIR. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

This new loan will serve to increase his capital, specifically for purchasing materials used in making sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making sandals

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice N. is an entrepreneur running a poultry business in Yombo Buza in Dar es Salaam. She raises broiler poultry for meat. The chicks are fed for only five weeks and then sold for slaughtering. She sells 600 broilers per batch. The business income generated is used to meet the family's daily demands and to raise capital for the business. She needs a loan of 700,000 TZS to buy more poultry chicks and to construct more poultry cages.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying more poultry chicks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Don Armando es un padre de familia de tres hijos, de 41 años de edad, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder equilibrar sus gastos, vive en el barrio Reparto Schick, desde hace un año instalo un pequeño taller de costura, en donde elabora ropa para dama y caballeros, su esposa también ya que es costurera, antes trabajaba como policía, renuncio por que su salario era bajo y no ajustaba con los gastos.
 Luego comienza atrabajar en el  mercado oriental en donde ahorro  dinero para poner el taller y poder tener su propio negocio, el local lo hizo ocupando una parte de su casa que aun no esta totalmente bien cerrado, pero con mucho de deseo de poder salir adelante con este proyecto. Con el financiamiento podrá invertir en tela, hilo, herramientas para el trabajo que ayuden a la producción. Con el objetivo de aumentar las ventas para mejorar su economia.
texts.en:
Don Armando is the father of three children. He is 41 years old and works with his wife to balance their expenses. They live in the Reparto Schick neighborhood. A year ago, Armando started a small sewing workshop where he produces clothing for women and men. His wife also works as a seamstress, but she previously worked as a police officer and later resigned because the pay was low and not enough to keep up with the expenses.

After saving some money, Armando moved his workshop to the eastern market so that he could establish his business. The location that was set aside in his home was not totally secure, but with great determination he was able to move forward with his business. This loan will be invested in fabric, thread, and work equipment to help with production. His goal is to increase his sales and improve his finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and work equipment

loans.name: Jude

texts.en: Jude F. is from the village of Olango. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 small children. To make a living, Jude owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jude has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever he sells his raised pigs. In 2009, Jude joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jude has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Jude is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jude from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene  21 años, vive con su  madre y sus dos hermanos en una casa arrendada. Hace mas de 10 meses se dedica a la venta de productos envasados, en donde se asoció con su madre y su hermana mayor. De esta manera su trabajo consiste en contratar jóvenes, quienes se encargarán de distribuir su producto en las diferentes bodegas de su ciudad. Entre los productos que vende son: condimentos envasados, sopa instantánea, fideos, entre otros. Ahora procura adquirir al por mayor su mercadería de proveedores, quienes le vende esto producto de marcas de calidad que satisfagan a su clientela. Desde entonces, el trabajo que ha desempeñado le ha  ayudado a crecer su negocio, por lo que esta pensando extender su mercado de ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para así tener mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karen, age 21, lives with her mother and her two siblings in a rented house. She has been selling packaged goods for over ten months. She works with her mother and her older sister. Her work consists of hiring young people to distribute the product to different grocery stores in her city. Some of the products she sells are packaged condiments, instant soup, and noodles, among others. Now she gets her merchandise wholesale from suppliers. They sell the brand and quality of products that satisfy her customers. Since then the work she has done has helped her business grow. She is thinking of expanding her sales market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she will be very responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise. That way she will have a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Teodomira

texts.es:
Teodomira es viuda y tuvo 4 hijos, ahora tiene 6 nietos que están a su responsabilidad porque su hija falleció, sus nietos están estudiando, Teodomira es el único sustento de su familia. Su mayor sueño es que sus nietos sean profesionales.
Teodomira tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 11 de la mañana y en las madrugadas vende en el mercado Nery, los animales los adquiere en las ferias y también de la ciudad de Lima. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carnero y cerdo. Teodomira tiene proyectado comprar una congeladora para guardar la carne.
Teodomira es socia del  Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Teodomira is widowed and has four children. She now has six grandchildren whom she must care for because her daughter passed away. Her grandchildren attend school. Teodomira is her family’s only means of support. Her greatest dream is that her grandchildren become professionals. She has a small stall in the city’s central market, where she sells meat. She does this daily from 11:00 AM and in the early morning she sells in the Nery market. She buys her animals in the local fairs and in Lima. She will use the money from this loan to buy sheep and hogs and plans to buy a freezer to store the meat. Teodomira is an associate of the Las Palmeras communal bank. What she likes the most is the training.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sheep and hogs

loans.name: Menka

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Menka S..  She is married and has 2 children, ages 20 and 21.  In 1998, she established  her thanka (statue) painting business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  Menka has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase additional painting supplies.  In the future, Menka plans to send her children to a good college.  She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her work

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia C. is from the town of Panglao. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a   fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in the market. Delia has been engaged in fishing for over five years. Aside from fishing, she also started raising hogs a few years back and she hopes to acquire more piglets that she could raise.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is a married woman with two children who are 17 and 19 years old. Her husband, Benjamin A., is a 49-year-old businessman. They live in Purok Taloot in Barangay Poblacion, located within Sibonga municipality on Cebu Island. Rosemarie earns her living operating an internet cafe and raising pigs.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

For this, her fourth loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a new computer for her internet café. With the profits she can repair and maintain her equipment and continue to save up for their future. Rosemarie A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa Virginia es soltera, trabaja en el Hotel El Bosque como administradora desde hace 20 años, sus hijos son mayores y ya tienen su propia familia. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa, como es reparacion de una pared y pintar la sala.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que AFODENIC le ha brindado, pues gracias a los creditos a podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Virginia is a single woman and she has been an administrator for the past 20 years in the El Bosque hotel. Her children are adults and they have families of their own. She requests a third loan with the goal of improving her home. She wishes to repair a wall and repaint the living room. She feels so grateful for the support Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has imparted on her. It is thanks to these loans that she has managed to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a wall and paint the living room.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en el paradero final de una empresa que hace servicio público llamada Cabildo, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella prepara caldos y segundos, su esposo trabaja como chofer y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y para comprar ollas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras communal bank. The bank is located within the district of Santiago, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Yovana is 41 years and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling food on foot at the final stop of the route for a public transportation company called Cabildo. She works from 8am to 6pm making soups and main course dishes. Her husband works as a driver and together, they get their children ahead. Yovana wants to improve her food selling business. She is requesting the loan to purchase cooking products and pots.

Yovana is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking products and pots.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen P.'s main source of income comes from selling personal products such as glasses and watches in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the town of Plaridel. Karen has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Karen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Karen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L., 34, lives in Khogana Dobato, one of the developing villages in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Including herself, there are three persons in her family. Her husband is Mr. Kamal L., who works in a noodle factory. Her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. L. opened her gift shop three years ago to improve her family's standard of living, because her husband's income alone is not enough to run the family smoothly. She sells various types of gift items in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 NPR to buy different types of gift items for her business.

loans.use: to buy different types of gift items for her shop

loans.name: Mahmadrachab

texts.ru: Алиев Махмадрачаб проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Уже 4 года как занимается животноводством и продажей мяса. Он в основном разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Mahmadrachab A. lives in the Varzob district.  He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has a higher education, as an economist; however, he does not work in that field.  Mahmadrachab has been involved in animal husbandry and meat sales for 4 years.  He primarily breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz tiene 20 años, vive con su madre en una casa alquilada. Desde que era niño conoció el arte del mate burilado, veía como lo elaboraban, desde entonces se convirtió en un experto en la elaboración de estos objetos artesanales. Hoy diseña diversos diseños, que son vendidos a los grandes comerciantes de artesanías de su ciudad y de otras ciudades. Su taller de trabajo esta instalado en el interior de su casa, que junto a su madre realizan esta actividad. Este negocio es rentable y ventajoso para Franz porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y estudiar, por ello desea tener un taller más grande, donde pueda contratar mano de obra para seguir elaborando estos mates burilados. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de calabazas que es el insumo principal para elaborar mates burilados.
texts.en: Franz is 20 years old and lives with his mother in a rented home.  Since he was a child, he has known the art of making decorative bowls (mate burilado); he observed how they were made and then became an expert in making these handicrafts himself.  Today, he makes various designs and sells them in the artisanal centers of the city and other cities.  His workshop is inside his home and he performs his craft with his mother.  Their business is profitable and advantageous for Franz because it gives him free time to study.  He would like to have a larger workshop where he can contract other workers to keep making his art.  This is his second loan through MFP and he is happy to know that he has financial support; he is also grateful to be part of the village bank because the other members of the bank are very responsible people.  He is grateful to all the people who will provide him this loan as it will help him to grow his business.  With the loan, he will invest in buying pumpkin/gourds which are the primary ingredient for his craft.

loans.use: Buy pumpkins to make decorative bowls and handicrafts

loans.name: Jonifa

texts.en:
Jonifa is 52 years old and married to Caleb, who is a driver. They are blessed with four children ages 27, 24, 20 and 17. Jonifa has been in the cloth-selling business for five years, thus being able to identify her potential clients.

Her husband is able to cover most of their expenses, while she concentrates on her business. The monthly income from her business is 30,000 KES.

This is her fourth loan from KADET. Successfully repaying her previous loans is a clear indication that she is doing well. She hopes one day to own a boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for sale.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina R. is from the village of North Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Ludivina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste and snack foods in the local community. She is also buying and selling generic medicines like paracetamol (acetaminophen). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ludivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years and employs 10 casual laborers. His main products are tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, milk, maize, beans and eggs which he sells locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His major challenges have been lack of enough farm inputs (fertilisers, etc.), pests, diseases and poor weather conditions which affect his production. In five years time, he hopes to acquire a truck that will assist in the transportation of his products to the market. 

Samwel is 39 years old and married with 6 children who are now between the ages of 2 and 18. All the children, except one, attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is 47 years old and lives in Parola, Binondo, Manila with her husband, Eduard Merced, who is also her business partner. They have four children who help them to run their restaurant business. Yolanda has a high school education and wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. 

For the past 20 years, Yolanda has been operating the family restaurant business. Family members make up the restaurant staff. The restaurant is strategically located at the populated area of Gate 54 Area C, Parola, Binondo, Manila. They have a large menu and serve all types of meals and snacks, including barbecue, smoked fish, and grilled meat and fish. At the end of the day, the family earns at least 1,000 PHP income.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 31,000 PHP to help to continue her business. She will use the loan to purchase needed items to improve the restaurant and to provide working capital to increase profit and savings. Yolanda admits that cost increases to purchase raw ingredients have affected her business as well as difficulties providing good service to avoid complaints from her customers and patrons. Still, Yolanda is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow.  She prays that she will be able to sustain her business and make it flourish so she can leave it as a legacy to her children.

Yolanda wishes a good, healthy and peaceful life for her family and prays that their house will be renovated before the end of this first quarter.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends weekly fellowship* meetings where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God and her life as a mother, a wife, and as a community partner.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase restaurant items and provide working capital

loans.name: Luis José

texts.es: El Sr. Luis José A. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “DISPESA” desempeñándose como Técnico Automotriz tiene  un año de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luis José A. is currently employed by a company named “DISPESA” as an automotive technician.  He has been employed by them for a year.  He is also married, with a school-aged child.

He has had a total of 5 loans with CEPRODEL, and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, rock, gravel, etc. to expand and improve his home.  These loans have greatly benefited him and his family, and have been a means by which their living conditions have been greatly improved.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: sand, Cement, rock, etc.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta E. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 54 years old. Restituta is married and has seven children. 

To make a living, Restituta plants and harvests rice for sale. She does her best to provide the needs of her family.

Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Restituta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man and the father of one school-age child. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced home painter; he has been working as a freelance home painter for almost 30 years. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a step ladder for his painting occupation. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is very thankful for the results. In the future, he is looking to further enlarge his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased profits.

loans.use: To purchase a step ladder

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.

Harriet has a business selling second hand clothes at market. She has been in this business for five years and works seven days a week.

Harriet has requested  for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of second hand clothes. Her goal for her business is to become a wholesaler.

Harriet lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy  more bales of clothing

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a married woman who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has 3 children. She has a fish selling business. She buys directly from fishermen and sells the fish to the market. Generosa is also a seaweed farmer.

Generosa has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. In the future, she hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: William Jair

texts.es: William Jair V. de 23 años y padre de un niño de 3,  es un negociante dedicado a la venta de alimentos como pasabocas, arepas, pasteles, hayacas y bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, en un puesto de ventas nuy elegante que tiene en Barranquillita: un sector de mucho movimiento donde abundan los negocios formales e informales y diversos mercados públicos, especializados para  carnes,   pescados,  flores y centros comerciales de ropa calzado y accesorios en general. Este es el ambiente donde está ubicado el negocio de William desde hace dos años,  el cual surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo  cuando nació y William debió   trabajar desde las 4: 00 am a 6:00 p.m. como hasta ahora lo hace. Su meta es capacitarse con la Fundación para lograr hacer un buen manejo administrativo de su negocio, así mismo lograr reunir un mayor capital de trabajo para ampliarlo y hacerlo crecer aplicándole todos sus esfuerzos. A William últimamente, su negocio le ha quedado pequeño, por eso requiere comprar una vitrina calentadora de mayor tamaño que la actual y también  materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus frituras,  porque cada día ingresan más clientes y sus productos se terminan rápidamente; esto es justamente en lo que invertirá con su  credikiva,  que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
William Jair V. is 23 years old and has a 3 year-old son.  His business is selling food such as snacks, corn cakes, pies, 'hallacas' (meat and vegetables in cornmeal dough, wrapped in plantain leaves), and drinks such as soda and beer, from a very smart sales location in Barranquillita.  This is a very busy sector where there are a lot of formal and informal businesses and a number of public markets specialized in selling meat, fish and flowers, and shopping centers which sell clothes, footwear and general accessories.  This is the area where William's business is located.  He has owned his business for two years and it came about because he needed to make income to support his son when he was born.  William had to work from 4.00am to 6.00pm as he still does today.

William's goal is to receive training from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that he can manage his business well and also gather together more working capital so that he can expand his business and grow it by putting in all his effort.

William's business has recently grown substantially.  For this reason, he needs to buy a larger heated display case than the one he currently owns and he also needs to buy raw materials and supplies for making his fried food because he has more and more customers every day and his products are selling out quickly.  This is what he will use his Kiva loan to buy.  This is his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to buy a heated display case and also raw materials and supplies for making his fried food

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 58 years old and single.

She earns a living by engaging in buying and selling of vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits & vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Nelly has been doing this business for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with seven children, four boys and three girls, five of whom graduated from school while two attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

Joyce has operated a poultry business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, especially disease outbreaks in her poultry business. She dreams of establishing another poultry business of egg-layers in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a clutch of chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clutch of chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 24 years old.  She is married and has 1 child.  Stella sells bread.  She borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía en la ciudadela de Machupicchu,ella vende mochilas,maletines,telares e individuales, la socia también hace trabajos en hilos y lo vende en forma independiente, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.   
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Valentina, 47, is a member of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling crafts in Machu Picchu.  She sells backpacks, satchels, textiles.  She also makes woven items that she sells independently.  She supports her children with this business.  She wants to expand the crafts sales and is asking for a loan to buy crafts at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Dios Bendice 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Jesimena is the group representative. She is the coordinator of the group "Dios Bendice 1 & 2" (God Bless). The group is located in La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industries dominate the economy. Jesimena and other members are Haitian emigrants. She has lived in the same community for many years and, for her entire life, she has been living day-to-day without a steady income. She is excited to be doing something different and is ready to make a change and begin to better her life. She hopes to help her children out of their poverty some day as well.

Jesimena plans to invest in her comedor (small restaurant in her neighborhood) by buying rice, beans, flour, oil, vegetables and meats. She cooks a daily lunch for different people in her community or employers and dreams of having a big restaurant in the nearest town. She will use her business profits to make structural changes in her business by buying new chairs, tables, re-painting and many other things.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has one child. Thamer has owned a bakery since 1995. He makes bread and pastries. He has long experience in this field. His bakery is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. He has a good reputation.

Thamer is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay the annual rent for his bakery. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his bakery.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De La Libertad Group

texts.es:
LOS EMPRENDEDORES DE L. LIBERTAD, es un grupo que trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde hace 4 meses, sus integrantes son personas dedicadas a actividades de comercio.
Desiret es L. actual secretaria del grupo, tiene 21 años y espera un hijo; para llevar el sustento a su hogar trabaja en una juguería y además se dedica a L. preparación de queques, chocolates para venderlos a sus vecinos.
ElL. nos cuenta que trabajo en una empresa en L. cual le obsequiaron una beca para estudiar Gastronomía de año y medio, el cual fue una oportunidad que agradece mucho y el cual le ha permitido dar clases en una escueL..
Su mayor anhelo es poner una juguería en L. cual pueda ofrecer sus productos y que le permita mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
El préstamo solicitado será invertido en L. compra de insumos para preparar masa elástica.
texts.en:
'Los Emprendedores de L. Libertad' is a group that has been working with EDAPROSPO for four months.  The group's members are people who work in commerce.

Desiret is the group's current secretary.  She is 21 years old and expecting a baby.  In order to provide for her household, she works in a juice bar and also makes cakes and chocolates which she sells to her neighbors.

Desiret tells us that she worked for a company who gave her a grant to study cookery for eighteen months.  This was an opportunity for which she was very grateful and it has allowed her to give classes in a school.

Desiret's biggest wish is to set up a juice bar where she can sell her products and improve her finances and quality of life.

Desiret will use the loan she has requested to invest in buying supplies for preparing 'masa elástica' (fondant cake covering).

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'masa elástica' (fondant cake covering)

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
