Les dix  femmes du groupe BENKADI III sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali, et ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SOUMBA  première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi III group are all married, mostly in plural families, in the city of Banco, the seat of a rural commune in the Dioïla prefecture, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.  On average, they are 43 years old with 4 children.  

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with include rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Soumba, the first person on the left in the row of seated women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 35,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen de 45 años de edad, reside en casa propia en zona urbana con su esposo de 44 años, su hijo y su nieto. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas. Día a día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y tener frescos y listos los ingredientes que le permiten hacer sus deliciosas pupusas. Tiene mucha clientela ya que cuando de pupusas se trata ella tiene las mejores y con los precios más accesibles, a base de maiz y arroz de chicharron, frijoles, queso y revueltas (todos los ingredientes). Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer de manera que pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida. Piensa invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, arroz, chicharon, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario de Carmen, age 45, lives in her own house in an urban zone.  She lives with her 44 year old husband, her son, and her grandson.

She makes and sells delicious “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).  She gets up early every day to go to the market.  She does this in order to have ready the fresh ingredients that allow her to make her delicious pupusas.  She has a lot of customers because, when it comes to pupusas, she has the best, and she has the most accessible prices.  They are made from a base of corn and “chicharron” (fried pork rinds) and stuffed with rice, beans, and cheese (all of the ingredients).

She has decided to get this loan from Integral in order to invest in her business.  Her dream is to see it grow in a way that she will be able to improve her quality of life.  She plans to invest in the ingredients she needs like corn, rice, chicharon, cheese, beans, tomatoes, and cabbage.  This way she hopes to manage to fulfill her dream and to be able to give her family an improved opportunity in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, chicharon, cheese, beans, tomatoes, and cabbage.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits and chips to sell

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión está formado por 14 socias quienes son amigas y vecinas, son mujeres trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ser independientes económicamente y al mismo tiempo pueden aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, este  lugar es de clima frió, tiene una gran riqueza cultural y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad especialmente los jóvenes.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Ana Victoria, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 26, 20, 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para solventar para sus gastos, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio,  sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de manera independiente.

Doña Ana Victoria se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y  a  criar cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura que es para su consumo y en días de ferias vende café con tamales y comida rápida en su comunidad. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y víveres para continuar con el negocio de venta de comida rápida.
 
Su meta es darles  a sus hijos una buena educación para que se superen y realizar su casa propia.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión comunal bank is made up of 14 members who are friends and neighbors. They are strong, hardworking women who work in different areas that allow them to be economically independent and at the same time able to contribute to household expenses. They live in the parish of Cumbe, a place with a cold climate and a rich culture, whose people maintain their parents’ traditions. The people work in trade, animal raising and agricultural, with many working in the city, especially the youth.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Ana Victoria, who lives in Cumbe parish. She is 43 years old and a single mother of 5 children, who are 26, 20, 17, 10 and 8 years old.
Her two oldest sons work to help with expenses, her third son is in high school and the two youngest attend a small school in the city. She does not have her own house and lives with her parents, but does so independently.

Ana Victoria takes care of household tasks and raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and cattle which she sells when she has some economic need. She is also a subsistence farmer and, during holidays, she sells coffee with tamales and fast food in her community.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she will use her new loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and supplies to continue with her business selling fast food.

Her goal is to provide her sons with a good education so they can succeed and also to have her own house.

The small photo attached here is of one of the members who, due to personal reasons, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and food supplies.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian, a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school, has had a business for the past three years selling beans and cooking oil in Hai Gwafa, located in Yei, South Sudan. She has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in the hopes of expanding her business. Vivian says that the extra income resulting from this loan will help her to build a store for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Edmundo

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su esposa y sus  dos hijos 12 y 17 años de edad, él se dedica a cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace treinta  años  y trabaja de promotor de salud en una clínica, de lunes a viernes y los sábados y domingos se dedica a los cultivos junto con su hijo mayor.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes y semillas, para iniciar la siembra, espera que con estos insumos le dará mejor producción, obtener más ingresos al venderlo al mercado y dejar una parte para el consumo de su familia.
El sueño de Francisco es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, darles lo necesario para que vivan mejor y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and his two children, aged 12 and 17. For the past thirty years he has grown corn and beans for a living. He also works as a health promoter in a clinic from Monday to Friday and on Saturday and Sunday he looks after the crop cultivation with his eldest son.

He will use the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and seeds to start off the sowing season. He hopes that this will improve production, increasing his income when he sells at market and at the same time leave some for his family.
 
Francisco’s dream is to support his children in their education, giving them what they need so that they will live better lives, in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Elda has a shop that sells general and hardware products like ropes, toilet bowls and electronic load credits for mobile phones. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock like ropes, toilet bowls and electronic load credits.

Elda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like ropes, toilet bowls and electronic load credits.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a divorced woman with two children who are enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Mwanamkuu has operated a beauty salon for the past five years; her potential clients are the local-area ladies. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where the demand is high only during the festive season. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of flexible loan repayment rates.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 60 años, es una mujer entusiasta y dinámica. Esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Guillermina consiste en la venta de comida, la cual está instalada en el mercado de su ciudad. Actividad que viene realiando desde hace nueve años, tiempo que le valió ser conocida en la zona logrando captar clientela. En este trabajo cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo para la atención al público. Lo que le gusta es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, y con ello pagar los gastos de su casa, además de  socializarse con las personas. Sin embargo, es hay veces que los precios de los productos para la elaboración de comidas no tienen un precio estable. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo, y así, tener su propio restaurante. Esto será el cuarto crédito con MFP, con el grupo que trabaja se siente cómoda porque son personas responsables y espera poder seguir bien y continuar trabajando con la institución. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará productos al por mayor tales como arroz, aceites y otros. Además de utensilios para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 60, is an enthusiastic and dynamic woman.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Together they live in her own home.

Guillermina's job consists of selling food, which is located in the market in her city.  She has been doing this job for nine years, time that has allowed her to become known in the area, managing to attract customers.  She has the help of her son to serve the public.

What she likes is that it allows her to have an economic income with which to pay the household expenses as well as to socialize with people.  Nevertheless, there are times that the prices of the ingredients for making dishes don't have a stable price.  Her wish is to continue growing and so have her own restaurant.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She feels comfortable with the group she works with because they are responsible people, and she hopes to continue doing well and continue working with the institution.

With the loan requested she will buy products wholesale, such as rice, oils, and others, as well as utensils to implement her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and utensils.

loans.name: Ilci Leojana

texts.es:
ILCI:
A sus 26 años, es madre de  2 niños, y  una mujer trabajadora, en su domicilio cuenta con un local donde vende ropa americana, cosméticos perfumería etc. También los fines de semana se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales, lo cual la hecho conocida y visitada por sus vecinos  en su negocio, ella requiere de capital para la compra de ropa de se segunda como suéteres, chumpas, chamarras, ya que debido a las grandes lluvias la gente ve la necesidad de abrigarse, sabe que la atención y la manera con que atiende a las personas que la visitan han sido parte de su crecimiento como pequeña negociante, como esposa colabora con sus ingresos al sustento de sus hijos y apoya a su esposo con proyectos que  tienen como pareja.
texts.en: Ilci, at her 26 years of age, is a mother of 2 children and a hardworking woman. In part of her house, she has an area where she sells used clothes, cosmetics and perfume, etc. At the weekends she also makes and sells tamales, which have made her popular and well frequented by her neighbours. She needs capital for her business to buy used clothes such as sweaters, jackets and windbreakers as due to the heavy rains people see the need to wrap up. She knows that the attention she pays people and the way she serves those who visit her have been part of her growth as a small busineswoman. As a wife she shares her income to support her children and supports her husband with projects they share as a couple.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Welcome Group

texts.en:
Tendai is a hard-working woman aged 49. She is married to a pastor with 4 children aged 29, 27, 22 and 10. Only one child attends school and the others are now adults. Tendai also takes care of two children who are related to her and whose parents passed away five years ago. Both children attend school. She lives in Gweru and she operates a bottle store in the city center. She buys beer from local breweries. She has five employees and the business has been running since 1983. 

Tendai was given a loan which she used to buy 50 crates of clear beer, 50 crates of scuds (a beer made from sorghum and maize), 50 crates of soft drinks and 30 bottles of of wine. The business is affected by shortages of stock due to unavailability of beer and soft drinks from local suppliers. 

She intends to have a cocktail bar and a restaurant five years from now. She will then be in position to send her children and other dependents to better schools and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soft drinks and wine to sell in her store.

loans.name: Verónica Gabriela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otras personas se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, salen en la tarde y no llegan sino hasta el dia siguiente con los productos que les da mar, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Llevan 11 años  dedicados a esta dura labor.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The 'Virgen Del Mar' Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful San Mateo resort in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Most inhabitants of this area work in fishing or sea-related businesses.

27-year-old Veronica lives in Manta with her partner, who is a fisherman. They have two sons aged seven and two, and the eldest is studying at school.
 
Veronica is a housewife who applied for this loan in order to help her spouse obtain the resources he needs to perform his work well. He is a fisherman, who goes out to sea in his small boat along with other men to carry out their work. They leave in the afternoon and do not return with their produce until the next day. Once they reach the shore, they deliver their produce to wholesalers for distribution throughout the province. They have been working hard at this tough business for 11 years.

This loan will be used to buy nets, lanyards, fuel and food for the days that they have to be at sea. Veronica has been a member of the bank for three years and she enjoys the unity that they have within the group. Her dream is to own a large boat for her partner to carry out his fishing operations.

loans.use: to buy nets, lanyards, fuel and food for her partner's fishing business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 28 años, es un joven trabajador, amable y bueno, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es por eso que vive en casa alquilada y trabaja mucho todos los días para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Edgar consiste en el transporte de pasajeros de manera colectivo dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Pasa sus días manejando su taxi, no importa si es de día o de noche, él sigue recorriendo las calles en busca de clientes que deseen llegar sanos y seguros a su destino. Su animo alegre y sus dotes de conversador hacen que los clientes lo busquen para que les haga una carrera, además que conoce muy bien las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa y siempre brinda un servicio rápido, al principio le fue complicado ya que le era pesado tener que manejar tanto, pero cuando empezó a ver lo rentable que le era y acoplarse al ritmo, logró consolidarse.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasear por las calles, ya que se distrae mucho, lleva 2 años realizando este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es tener que lidiar con algunos pasajeros que no pagan su pasaje. Espera más adelante comprar otro taxi y hacerlo trabajar para mejorar sus ingresos. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además está muy comprometido con el pago de sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará algunas piezas y materiales para refaccionar su vehículo, además de renovar su documentación que está a punto de caducar.
texts.en:
28-year-old Edgar is a hard-working, friendly young man.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  For this reason, he lives in a rental house and works a lot every day so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  Edgar's job is providing a collective passenger transport service both within the city and outside the city.  He spends his days driving his taxi, working either days or nights.  He drives the streets in search of customers who want to arrive at their destination safe and sound.  He is a cheerful man and his talents as a conversationalist mean that his customers seek him out so that he can give them a ride.  In addition, he knows the streets of the city of Pucallpa very well and always provides a quick service.  At first things were complicated as it was difficult having to drive so much.  However, when he started to see how profitable it was and he got into a rhythm, he managed to grow in his business.

What Edgar most likes about his work is driving through the streets as he really enjoys himself.  He has been in this line of work for two years and what he least likes about it is having to argue with some passengers who don't pay their fare.  He hopes, in the future, to buy another taxi and to work with it so that he can improve his income.  

This will be Edgar's second loan from MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support.  This makes him feel certain that he can make progress with his business.  He pledges faithfully that he will make his loan repayments on time as he did with his previous loan.  Edgar will use the loan for 1,000 soles that he has requested to buy some spare parts and materials for his vehicle.  He will also renew his documentation [driver's license] which is about to expire.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car and to renew his driver's license

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and married with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has a retail business located in the same area in which she started 11 years ago with a capital of UGX 1,000,000. She has a stock of UGX 3,500,000 currently. It is through this business that she has been able to educate her children and expand her business. Inadequate capital is a hindering factor to the expansion of her business. Mary wants a loan to buy rice, maize flour, sodas, and other merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, sodas, and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jormoh Group

texts.en:
Richard is treasurer of the loan group 'Jormor' group of 6 members, which is a client of the field partner ID-Ghana. He is forty-one years old, married and father to two children who all attend school.

Richard has been selling hard wear from his shop for 15 years. He will use his loan to buy cement,paints,iron rods, nail and other building materials.

His aim is to have more loans to increase his business results, educate and feed his children. She is grateful to ID-Ghana for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

With his other hardworking counterparts, they promise to hold each other responsible for the repayment of loans in loyalty.

loans.use: to buy cement,paints,iron rods, nail and other building materials.

loans.name: Natalia Guadalupe

texts.en:
In Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon lives Natalia. She is married and has a small child, and she busies herself in the sale of clothing. But her sales have been dropping a great deal and she does not see the income that she once had. She has not been able to work at her business following her little one\'s illness. He has some medical problems including asthma, and he was hospitalized for that not long ago. Now he needs an expensive treatment.

She needs to recover her sales in order to help her son. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover all the costs. To be able to make it through she requires a loan of $250 that she will use to purchase merchandise and achieve her goal. Natalia and her son need you help. The decision is in your hands. They will sincerely thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Cadereyta, Nuevo León vive Natalia, ella es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Pero sus ventas han bajado mucho y ya no percibe los ingresos que antes tenia, pues ha descuidado un poco el negocio a causa de la enfermedad de su pequeño. El tiene problemas físicos de asma y hace poco lo tuvo internado en el hospital, y ahora requiere de un tratamiento muy costoso.

Ella quiere poder recuperar sus ventas para poder ayudar a su hijo, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza a cubrir todos lo gastos. Para poder lograrlo ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y poder lograr su objetivo. Natalia y su hijo necesitan de tu apoyo, la decisión esta en tus manos, ellos te lo vana agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy different variety of foods for her growing hotel.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., 51 years old mother of 3 children, lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She builds many rooms to rent them to the local garment workers and can typically makes around $3/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, is a police man , two of her children are garment workers and therefore the rest is a student. In order to increase the family's savings, S. is requesting for a loan amount of $300 to build more rooms so that she is able to makes more additional money to keep investing in this business for year to come.

loans.use: To build more rooms in order to rent to the garment workers.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.en:
Jose Hector is a 64 year old widower who has eight children. Finding it very difficult to find a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business six years ago selling groceries. He started out selling a small selection of basic products and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. His business has expanded greatly thanks to his efforts and he was recently able to purchase a larger refrigerator.

Jose is requesting a loan of US $650 to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

José Héctor es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, tiene 64 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 8 hijos. Ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo y para obtener los recursos que necesita, José inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace seis años, comenzó con muy pocos productos, los de mayor demanda, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor e incorporando la venta de más productos, recientemente ha adquirido un enfriador más grande y su negocio ha crecido mucho gracias al buen trabajo que realiza día con día.

En estos momentos, José necesita un crédito de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de José y ayudarlo a continuar creciendo con su negocio, no lo dudes más, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para José, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Selestina Ikun

texts.id:
Mrs. Selestina rents her apartment. It has one living room, one bedroom, one bathroom and a very small kitchen. She stores all the rice she picks up from the agent in the living room. Her customers are mostly her neighbors. If they run out of rice, the just order it through Mrs. Selestina. She picks up the rice almost everyday from the agent. She usually picks up 5-6 sacks depending om the order she receives. Some customers pay as you go by cash while others pay once a month. She has been doing the business for one year. Her profit could get as much as 1,500,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). Considering living cost of 50,000 IDR per day and children's education expense of 100,000 IDR per month they need at least 1,600,000 IDR per month to cover the costs. Her husband's income is 250,000 IDR per month. So there is a little money left to be saved. The loan will be used to add the working capital- since many customers do not pay in advance. The large capital will help her grow the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Selestina menyewa sebuah rumah kos sebagai tempat tinggalnya. Tempatnya mempunyai satu ruang tamu, kamar tidur, kamar mandi dalam dan dapur yang sempit. Di ruang tamu inilah dia menaruh beras yang diambilnya dari Agen. Langganannya hampir semua orang yang tinggal di sekitar kos-kos-annya. Jika mereka kehabisan beras mereka, tinggal memesan ke Bu Selestina. Hampir setiap hari dia mengambil beras di Agen. Dia bisa mengambil 5-6 karung, sesuai dengan pesanan. Ada yang langsung membayar; ada juga yang membayarnya sebulan sekali. Usaha ini telah ditekuninya selama setahun. Keuntungan dari usaha ini mencapai Rp 1.500.000,00 per 2 minggu. Apabila dipertimbangkan dengan biaya hidup per hari meraka yang Rp 50.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak mereka per bulan yang Rp 100.000,00. Maka akan dibutuhkan Rp 1.600.000,00 per bulannya. Penghasilan suaminya Rp 250.000,00 per bulan. Jadi masih uang ada yang bisa ditabung. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya akan dia gunakan sebagai tambahan modal – mengingat pelanggan tidak membayar di muka. Modal yang besar akan membantu dia mengembangkan usaha ini.

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Mrs. Catherine O. is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells medicine to people living in her community. She had 2 years' training before she opened her own business in 1973. She is in need of $625 to enable her to buy more medicine for sale. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Taurina

texts.es:
Taurina is 70 years old. Despite her age, she’s very engaged in the work that she does. She sells alfalfa in the Victoria market, in the Esperanza District in the province of Trujillo, department of Libertad. She also raises ducks, which she sells at certain times.

Taurina has 8 independent children. She doesn’t know how to read or write because she never went to school.

She began her business by selling alfalfa at home, in small quantities. But, thanks to the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US approx.) that she got from her bank, “Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas” and with the support of a friend, she was able to find a place to sell insiD. the local market.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 500 soles ($167US approx.), which will be repaid in 4 months, she’ll buy 125 pounds of alfalfa and food for her animals.

Taurina is eager to finish her house with all the final touches and to make it more comfortable.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Taurina tiene 70 años D. edad, a pesar D. su avanzada edad es muy empeñosa con el trabajo que realiza, se dedica a la venta D. alfalfa (yerba) en condición D. ambulante en el mercado Victoria ubicado en el distrito D. La Esperanza provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. También se dedica a la crianza D. patos, los cuales venD. en ciertas temporadas.

La señora Taurina tiene 8 hijos pero todos independientes. No sabe leer ni escribir porque nunca asistió a la escuela.

Inició su negocio vendiendo alfalfa en su casa, en cantidades pequeñas, pero gracias al primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas” y al apoyo D. una amiga, consiguió un lugar donD. vender dentro del Mercado D. la zona.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.500.00 (aproximadamente $167), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 5 arrobas D. alfalfa y alimento para sus animales.

La señora Taurina anhela terminar su casa con todos sus acabados y tener más comodidad.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa (food for domestic animals)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a cooler

loans.name: Haw's Kitomondo C Group

texts.en:
Judith, 39 years old, is married with two children, ages 10 and 12. Judith started selling clothes 2 years ago, and everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business.

In the past, Judith has taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Socorro María

texts.es:
Mrs. Socorro J. is native of the municipality of Condega, and she began her business four years ago selling clothing for gentlemen, ladies and children. With a lot of effort and many sacrifices Mrs. Socorro J. started her business selling low quantities of merchandise, but as time passed by she improved her business as she now offers clients a larger variety of products.

It is worth mentioning that her business has improved due to the loans she has been granted by Ceprodel. Mrs. Socorro J. has used these loans to purchase more merchandise and to invest on her store’s infrastructure. Nowadays, in order to continue with her clothing business and buy merchandise from her suppliers, once again she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel, so she can invest on her business, which is the only venue of income for her and her young child.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Socorro J. originaria del municipio de Condega se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de venta de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños en su local de habitación. Con mucho esfuerzo y grandes sacrificios inició su negocio vendiendo poca mercadería pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha mejorado el negocio brindando a los clientes mas variedad en sus productos.

Es necesario destacar que para haber llegado al punto en el que se encuentra ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel los cuales nos cuenta que le han beneficiado grandemente porque así ha logrado comprar la mercadería a sus proveedores y además ha invertido en la infraestructura de su local. Hoy en día para continuar con el negocio tiene la necesidad de adquirir la ropa de sus proveedores y por este motivo una vez mas solicita prestamos en Ceprodel para continuar con el negocio que es el único ingreso para ella y su pequeños hijo.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Maria F. began selling groceries three years ago when her husband was let go from his job. At that time they both decided to invest all they had in this business so that they could satisfy their basic needs and afford everyday expenditures. Today their business generates a lot of income and they have been able to move forward with expenditures and assume responsibility for their situation.

Martha is asking for a $475 loan so that she can enlarge and remodel her store. She will repay the loan in 6 months. With your help her goal will be reached.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Martha F. se Inicio en la venta de Abarrotes hace tres años, debido a que su esposo fue liquidado de su empleo, al verse ambos con la responsabilidad de los gastos económicos y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, decidieron invertir lo de la liquidación en el negocio, que hasta hoy en día les ha dejado buenos ingresos y han podido salir adelante con todos los gastos y responsabilidades.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito por US $475 a 6 meses, para ampliar y bordear el local. Con tu contribución esto podrá hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Remodel the store

loans.name: Resplandecer Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother of 4 kids (ages: 5, 6, 11, 12) and lives in the town of Samana where she will soon begin selling shoes and clothing on the streets and to her friends. She will use this loan to purchase her items from a local flea market, and then will walk around to different homes and businesses selling the items. This is a very common business in the DR, and Francisca is confident that she will be successful. She has several ideas of how to differentiate her business. Her favorite foods are rice and lentils, and she said that in her free time she visits people who are sick and spends time talking with them. She has dreams of being a professional in the future, and wants to begin taking classes at the University soon.

Thank you for supporting this group of amazing people!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Perlas De German Buch Group

texts.es:
The 11 members of "Germán Busch" form a very united and organized group centralized in the Huayna Potosí area of the city of El Alto, Bolivia. Only eight of the members finished their schooling, the rest of the group sadly learned to read and write only at a very basic level. It has been a dream for them to enroll in a school for adults to finish their education but at the moment they lack the necessary resources to do it. The majority of the members are mainly dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables on the distinct city streets of El Alto. With winter here, the prices for these products tend to rise as a result of frosts on the plantations. It's for this reason they needed to reinforce their capital to acquire their goods, which they do every two weeks. They also want to be able to rent or buy sales posts in the city markets to ensure their sales and better preserve their products. In this way they'll be able to increase their earnings and be able to afford going to school and give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona Huayna Potosí se encuentra el centro focal “Germán Busch” dentro este centro encontramos a la asociación denominada “Perlas de Germán Busch”, 11 miembros forman un grupo muy unido y organizado. Solo 8 de ellas tiene estudios culminados el resto lamentablemente aprendió a leer y escribir da manera muy básica, siendo un gran sueño él poder entrar a la escuela de adultos para culminar sus estudios que de momento por falta de recursos no pueden hacerlo. La mayoría de ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de fruta y verdura en distintos calles de la ciudad del Alto. ahora que el invierno llego, este tipo de productos tiende a subir de precio por las heladas en las plantaciones, Es por eso que necesitan reforzar su capital para la adquisición de estos productos, que lo realizan quincenalmente, además desean poder alquilar o comprar puestos en mercados o tambos de esta ciudad para asegurar las ventas y la conservación de sus productos De esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y con esto poder culminar sus estudios y apoyar a que sus familias tenga una mejor forma de vida

loans.use: Purchase goods and rent or buy sales posts / necesitan creditos para reforzar su capital de trabajo y tambien poder alquilar puestos en mercados.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in many goods in order to keep operating a small greocery store.

loans.name: Jasmina Iveth

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Viejo of the city of Chinandega, Señora Jasmina G. has been dedicated for four years to her small general store business, offering all kinds of products from food to personal and home products. She is a mother of two children who has the obligation to maintain them and also to provide them with the needs for their studies.

Today the need that this lady faces is the urgency to buy the products for her general store, and for this reason she has requested a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of said products, so that she may continue with her business that so requires investment for its respective development.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Jasmina G. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de pulperia ofreciendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos personales y del hogar. Es madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene la obligacion de mantener y ademas de proporcionarles las necesidades para sus estudios.

Hoy en dia la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la urgencia de comprar los productos para su pulperia y opr este motivo acude a Cerpodel para obtener el credito necesario para la compra de dichos productos y asi continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de inversion para su respectivo desarrollo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small general store.

loans.name: Mtumwa's Bora Utu Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 28 and married with 3 children aged 11, 8 and 6. She has been a charcoal, firewood and snacks seller since 2007. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Mtumwa now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with restaurant, clothes sales, snack sales, charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase welding materials

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria es casada, madre de tres niños pequeños y realizó estudios superiores. Actualmente tiene 38 años de edad y vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró lana para tejer ropa para bebes. Desde los 12 años de edad empezó a tejer para vender en la Plaza, después trabajó en artesanía donde también aprendió más sobre tejidos. En la actualidad se dedica a confeccionar ropa de bebes, los cuales teje y los envía a Chile donde le hacen pedidos cada 15 días.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará lana de diferentes colores para tejer chompas, chalecos y ropa de bebes.

Su sueño es progresar mucho más y no tener problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is married, has three young children and completed her secondary education. She is currently 38 years old and lives in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte (no house number), Juli district, Chuchito province, departament of Puno. She is one of the members of the "Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she bought wool to weave baby clothing. When she was 12 years old she started to weave to sell in the Plaza, then she worked in crafts where she also learned more about weavings. At the present time she works making baby clothing, which she weaves and sends to Chile where they place orders every 2 weeks. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy wool of different colors to weave sweaters, jackets and baby clothing. Her dream is to progress much more and not have economic problems.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy different colors of wool.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Él es agricultor desde hace 30 años, actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia. Para Juan la cosecha es lo que más le agrada realizar, ya que es menos pesada y mucho más relajante, además, estos productos son muy demandados por temporadas y el producir en mayores cantidades logra que sea más rentable.  Lo difícil es sembrar y cuidar las plantas en sus primeros años de producción para obtener frutos de mayor calidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Juan invertirá lo que solicita en la compra de abonos y plantas de café, producto que se inicia en producir.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and children. He has been a farmer for the past 30 years and has been able to support his family. According to Juan, the harvest is the most enjoyable because it is less tedious and more relaxing. However, the crops require much work during the seasons and to produce them in large quantities for wholesale distribution is much more profitable. The difficulty is planting the crops and taking care of them in the first years of production to ensure high quality fruit. This is his first loan with MFP. Juan will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and coffee bean plants, a crop that he will start producing.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and coffee bean plants

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth E. lives in Sambou village in Kandal province. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar (2.47 acres) of land to cultivate rice. On the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have rice seed and her field sits in infertile soil. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Sareth E. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She will use the rest of the money to purchase fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: For a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to support the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en:
Shamama F. is an enterprising woman.  She is always happy to do good work.  When she was young, she had a big desire for self-improvement.  

For about 10 years, she has been running a sheep-breeding business.  This activity allows her to support her three children, who are the reason for her being.  She has raised them with the help of her husband.  

Her three children are enrolled in school.  Shamama lives with them and with her parents. For this reason, she wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them.  

Shamama has recommended her as a client with a good loan history, so AqroInvest trusts her.  With your support, she will be able to buy new animals.  Let's support this mother’s proposal!

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Salma Munir Hussain Group

texts.en:
Salma baji has owned a two room brick house in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 18 years. She is married to M. H. and he has been selling cloth for 6 years. He buys cloth on demand of his customers,  from famous cities know for their fabrics like Multan and Lahore.
  
Salma baji is a mother with one son who is 5 years old. He studies in a school located near their house. Salma baji is able to meet much of her sons financial needs. She pays off his school fees from the profits of her seamstress business. Her husband is very happy with this support. She is applying for a loan to buy cloth to expand her husband’s cloth selling business. 

She is the group leader for several other women in her locality. Jamila baji and Yasmeen akhtar baji each want a loan to buy cloth to sell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Naseem begum baji wants a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy O. is a 26-year-old mother of three children ages 8, 5, and 1 and a half. She is married to a mechanic. Nancy runs a tailoring shop and would like to expand it. She sees anywhere between 6 and 10 customers a day at her home in Nyamasaria. She likes running her own business because every once in a while she is able to buy things for her home. Nancy says that because of financial insecurity, her children sometimes cannot go to school. She is asking for 10,000 KSH for materials for her shop and to help with school fees.

loans.use: materials for seamstress business and school fees

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 27 años de edad, está casado hace 2 años y tiene un hijo.

          Se dedica a la activación, venta y reparación de aparatos celulares de diversos tipos. Cuenta con un local alquilado que funciona hace 5 años en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad. También recibe el apoyo económico de su madre quien es docente jubilada. En su negocio vende también repuestos y accesorios para celulares que son muy solicitados por su numerosa clientela. Además realiza servicios de mini cargas (servicio de recarga de saldos a celulares).
        Es un joven muy responsable y sacrificado que ha logrado salir adelante en base a esfuerzos y trabajo constante.
       En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más aparatos celulares de manera a poder aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Marcial is 27 years old, has been married for two years, and has a son. He has a business activating, selling, and repairing various kinds of cellular phones. For five years, he has had a rented stall in a well-located area of the city. He also has financial support from his mother, who is a retired teacher. Marcial also sells spare parts and accessories in his shop, which are in very high demand from customers. In addition, he recharges the balances of cell phones.

Marcial is a very responsible and self-sacrificing young man who has gotten ahead through his own efforts and hard work. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cell phones so that he can increase his stock on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: B. Betty is the leader of Zibula atudde women's group of Kyetume. She is a hard working lady with a business selling used shoes of all kinds that she buys from Owino and Kisekka market areas in Kampala and sells from her home area in Kyetume Central market. She is married and her six children are all still in school. This is why she works so hard to clear their school fees on time every term. She has also been a tailor for six years, and she does both jobs concurrently, making double profits in addition to the cows and pigs that she also keeps at her home. She plans to sell two pigs to cater for her children’s school fees and the loan will help to buy more shoes and school uniform materials for tailoring. She is so grateful that people are helping her and the rest of the members with loans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing materials

loans.name: Afruz

texts.en:
"Dear my friend i am very thankful to you for the loan."

This kind woman applied to Kiva for a second loan. The first loan, which she received in 2007, was repaid successfully.

Now Afruz needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy clothes and shoes to get a good income.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Hajida

texts.en:
Hajida P. was born in 1955. She comes from a suburb of the town of Tuzla. She is married and her husband is retired. Her children live out of the house since they are married.

Hajida is a housewife who grows vegetables for her own use and raises chickens for her own use and for sale. She is our loyal client and she already took four loans from WWI (Žene za Žene International). All of these loans were invested in her poultry business.

Hajida requested her fifth loan from WWI to purchase more chickens and poultry food. The income from this business increases their home budget significantly.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo S. M. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur and married woman. She has a food shop business at Yombo Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells different types of food crop products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, and cooking oil. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers in wholesale and from the Kariakoo city market. She meets her daily family demands from her business income. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to add capital to the business.

loans.use: To add capital to the business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells drinks and frozen foods such as turkey, chicken and fish. Faith is 45 years old and married with five children. Faith is asking for a loan of NGN 70, 000 to purchase more drinks and frozen food to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and frozen foods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Itiji West in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 15,17 and 20 years.

Joyce started her own cafe business selling food 1year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like rice,cooking oil for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,joyce hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice,wheat for her business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros.
Roberta es casada, tiene 70 años y 9 hijos, Roberta viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales y luego los procesa en harinas, actividad que realiza en un molino alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado la Victoria.
Roberta necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada.
Los sueños D. Roberta son construir su casa y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Roberta is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. los Milagros” (Lord of Miracles). She is 70 years old, married, and has 9 children. Roberta travels to different fairs in the region to buy grains that she later processes into flour using a rented grain mill. She sells her products at the Victoria Market.

Roberta needs a loan of 600 soles to purchase wheat and barley. She dreams of building a house and making future improvements to it.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Abdel Wahab

texts.en: Abdel Wahab is a 39-year-old married man and father of 1 child. He has owned a wheel shop since 1999 in his town. Today, Abdel Wahab is requesting to borrow $ 1,000 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Calen

texts.es: La señora Calen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de la Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos, ubicada a fuera de su casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde. Tiene 01 año trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Calen, se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Calen belongs to the communal bank, "Manos Unidas" (United Hands), in the district of Morales, in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín. She has a live-in boyfriend, is 40-years-old, and has 3 children who still depend on her. Her fighting spirit and desire to get ahead through her own means have caused her to start her own business selling kebabs. Her business is located outside of her house in an area that is fixed up well. Little by little, she has made herself known among her customers, and she tells us that today this kind of business is going very well for her. She sells every day starting at 6:00 in the evening. She has had this business for one year, and she is very happy with what she does. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy supplies such as rice in sacks, eggs, chickens for her "juanes" (a local dish made of chicken, rice, olives, and eggs wrapped in a leaf), and gutted chickens for her kebabs. She will also buy kitchen utensils so she can offer high-quality service. Calen feels at peace and happy with what she does, and she thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to her fulfilling her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy supplies so she can prepare her food

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. Sara D. is from the village of Doyong, Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture in fishing and selling the catch to the local community. She joined PMPC October 6, 2005 to have access to their programs and services. She earns a monthly net income from her business of 4,000.00 PHP. 
Currently, she's availing her 8th cycle loan in the amount of PHP 7,500 for the purpose of additional capital for her fishing business. Now, with the loan she is able to have enough supply of fingerlings.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For purchase of fingerlings

loans.name: Good Shepherd Group

texts.en:
Florence is forty-eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence is a petty trader. She sells printed textile goods. Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Good Shepherd'. Most of the group members are either into sales or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Florence, the group leader, is seated in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Amilo

texts.en:
Amilo R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market, but she is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell.  Amilo is 30 years old and married.  Her husband is a mechanic and they have five children who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is twenty-nine years old. She is the married mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Sophia works hard to support her husband so as to be able to provide for the family. She trades in underwear for ladies and other clothing. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community. She says she also treks to other communities to sell.

Sophia has been in business for two years and says the loan will help her to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy underwear in bulk.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr.  Juan A. García  tiene 20 años es soltero  vive con su madre la Sra. Carmela García  que tiene 65 años ancianita, él  mantiene a su madre con su trabajo, el padre falleció hace 20 años con una enfermedad  desconocido,  Juan se dedica a producir  papa, zapallo tiene experiencia en el manejo de cultivos y los tratamientos fitosanitarios, los insumos agrícolas compra de la feria de colomi, la semilla de papa, la semilla de zapallo y los agroquímicos.
 
El Sr. Juan vive en la zona de Corani a 35 km de colomi, esta en la provincia chapare en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona, en la visita a la zona  se ha visto la construcción de su casa y es muy precaria, pero la zona es muy apta para la siembra de papa y zapallo.

El Sr. Juan nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de papa y  zapallo ampliar los cultivos y  con la ganancia  construir una vivienda adecuada y cumplir con los sueños de su madre de tener casa propia, el Juan piensa tener familia y para eso debe  tener casa propia en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Juan A. García is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother Carmela García who is 65 years old. He supports his mother through his work, his father passed away 20 years ago from an unknown illness. Juan produces potato and pumpkin. He has experience in cultivation and plant health treatments. He buys his agricultural supplies from the market at Colomi - potato seed, pumpkin seed and agrichemicals. Juan lives in the Corani zone 35km from Colomi, in the Chapare province of Cochabamba. This zone is quite remote from the city and therefore it is difficult for them to go to the banks for a loan. This is why Cidre had the initiative to go to this zone. On the zone visit they saw that the construction of his house is very unstable, but the zone is very suitable for growing potato and pumpkin. Juan tells us that his greatest dream is to continue producing potato and pumpkin, to increase the crop and with the profits build a suitable house and fulfill his mother's dreams of having her own home. Juan is thinking of having a family and therefore needs to have his own home in the best condition possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for growing Potato and Pumpkin

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Muslima A., age 42, is married. She has 2 children, ages 18 and 14. Muslima owns a clothing Store from where she sells women’s clothers making. 

This will be Muslima’s 1st Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business. 

Muslima will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Muslima is seated 2nd from the left, wearing a dark dress.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the stock of the clothes store

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza M. is a new ASHI member. She is woman full of determination to rise above poverty. She is married and the mother of three minor children. She lives in Antipolo, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

She decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to access capital for her sari-sari store (general store). Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos to pay for 15 sacks of charcoal, cases of soft drinks and many other groceries for the store.

With the opportunity given to her by ASHI and Kiva, she believes that she is getting nearer to the fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.use: Pay for 15 sacks of charcoal, cases of soft drinks and many other groceries for the store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose B. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Jose owns and operates a business offering "habal-habal" motor transport services in the local community (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Jose has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Jose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jose is requesting a new loan of 9,200 PHP which will be used to repair his existing motorcycle to provide better service. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Dominga Anastacia

texts.es: La señora Dominga está solicitando un crédito  dice que los préstamos han influido favorablemente en su vida, ya que le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Además de esto Dominga sabes muy bien la elaboración de repostería, pues lo realiza cuando no tiene mucho trabajo, ya que siempre está luchando con sus hijos  por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que han atacado a su familia y a ella ultimadamente. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa nueva. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para dejárselas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is asking for funding; she says that the loans have been a positive influence in her life because they have helped her generate profits that have helped her meet household expenses. Dominga knows how to make pastries very well; she makes them when she doesn't have a lot of work to do because she is always struggling with her children. Her only problem has been illnesses that have befallen her family and herself lately. She is asking for funding to buy new clothing. She dreams with improving her dwelling so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia N. est une vendeuse d’huile de palme, d’arachide et d’haricots au marche de Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 25 ans et membre de la caisse depuis novembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère  de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 6 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Elle exerce son activité  depuis 2000.Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat des produits qu’elle commercialise. C’est après  son mariage qu’elle  a pense a exercer cette activité  pour pouvoir soutenir son mari dans la gestion du foyer conjugal. Ce crédit qui est son deuxième  au sein de l’institution va lui permettre d’augmenter ses  revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia N. retails palm oil, peanut oil and green beans at the Bambilor market. She is 25 years old and a member of the credit loan group since November 2009. She is married and mother of two children, aged three and six. She has been active in retail since 2000, and has already been granted one previous loan. She is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs to buy the products she retails. She thought of this activity after getting married, as a means to assist her husband in managing household expenses. This second loan from the institution will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 34-year-old lady living in Hoima, Uganda. She is married with two children aged 9 and 7 years. She sells cereals and dry foods and has been in the business for five years. She says the business is good because from its gains, she has been able to build a house and educate her children. She would like to have more stores with business stock in order to be a large-scale supplier of cereals and dry foods. She was, at first, a pump attendant at a petrol station before she started the produce business. The purpose of the loan is to buy rice, maize and millet to resell.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and millet

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is a 42-year old married woman who lives in Pinoy Brgy Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and selling school supplies.

Myrna’s husband Danilo is a school supplies vendor and he helps his wife in the business to support the family. They have three children between 17 and 24 years old, two of whom are already working and helping the family.

Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running her store and now earns an average monthly income of Php 36,000.

Myrna is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund her general store and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan, Php 28,000, which she intends to use on her general store and school supplies vending businesses. Myrna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure and is a single mother with one child.

Angela is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, running a cafeteria, by purchasing pineapple, cheese meat and sauces. She will use the profits to invest in her home by changing the wooden walls to cement blocks and to educate her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pineapple, cheese meat and sauces for her cafeteria

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is With Us. He is 44 years old, married and has one child, who is 16 years old. He was only able to complete 12th grade due to poverty. He cares for eight siblings.

For 15 years, Emmanuel has been selling spare parts and repairing all kinds of vehicles in Gardnerville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells durable spare parts and does his vehicle repairing job well, which keep customers returning.  

He plans to use his 30,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 100,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more vehicle spare parts and to renovate his mechanic shop. His goal is to grow his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Emmanuel is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle spare parts and renovate his mechanic shop

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mr. Un C., age 54, makes a living driving a taxi trailer-motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community for fees. He currently earns an average of $3 a day and has been running his business for years. Beside this, he raises poultry in a stall next to his house for extra profit. 

Un C. is the father of three school-aged children. His wife sells a few grocery items to earn a living. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. 

This is the second cycle of loans Un C. has pursued.  He will be using this loan to help increase his wife's business capital and decorate a taxi trailer-motorcycle.

loans.use: To help increase his wife's business capital and decorate a taxi trailer-motorcycle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Gemma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Sr. David  tiene 21 años y vive con su madre . El desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  con su tío  vendiendo  lomitos y hamburguesas en la calle ,gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró montar un modesto puesto de ventas de hamburguesas  hace un año.
Este puesto está ubicado en la vereda de la casa de su madre , donde su familia le ayuda con el negocio. 
El crédito será de ayuda para poder adquirir otra plancha para cocinar hamburguesa , así como también comprar los productos en cantidad ya que trabaja de martes a domingos.
David  anhela poder formar un negocio familiar que les permita ofrecer   educación, alimento y bienestar  a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. David is 21 years old and lives with his mother. When he was very young, he started working with his uncle selling lomitos [steak tenderloin sandwiches] and hamburgers in the street. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, he was able to set up a modest hamburger stand a year ago. The stand is located on the sidewalk in front of his mother's house, where his family helps him with the business. The loan he is requesting will help him to acquire another grill for cooking hamburgers. It will also help him buy products wholesale, which is important because he works from Monday to Sunday. David dreams of being able to build a family business that will allow him to offer education, food, and well-being to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a grill for cooking hamburgers, as well as egg, cheese, ham, hamburger, bread, meat, tomato, and lettuce

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Усмонов Манучехр проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с матерью. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Манучехр не имеет высшего образования. Вместе с другом арендует помещение, где открыл дилерский центр. Он в основном продает сим карты, пополняет балансы, делает ксерокопию документов. В этой области уже 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа новых сим карт. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Manuchehr U. lives in Vahdat. He is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his mother. His wife is a housewife. Manuchehr does not have a higher education. He and his friend rent a space where he has opened a kiosk. He basically sells SIM cards, adds minutes to phone balances, and makes copies of documents. He has been doing this for two years. He is taking out a loan to buy new SIM cards. He wants to expand his business and earn a greater profit.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new SIM cards

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian J. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old and is married with five adult children. Lilian owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
