About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Ampalaya, Brgy. Gun-ob, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and pig fattening. Her husband Angelo P., who is 25 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have a 5-year-old child. Geraldine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Geraldine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use for the expansion of her pig-fattening business and to purchase a second-hand motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for the future, improve their house and expand their business. Geraldine P. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Expansion of her pig-fattening business and the purchase of a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Baybay, Brgy. Villa Paz, El Nido, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a furniture business.  Her husband Benito D., Jr., who is 46 years old, works as a furniture maker to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are 12 to 24 years old. Rosela joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF- Project Dungganon, Rosela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional materials so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for the family. Rosela D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 37-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and three kids. Youssef has worked in construction since 2008 as a freelancer with 12 years of experience. 

Youssef also works in agriculture and in transporting construction materials. This is his fourth loan cycle with Al Majmou and he's the perfect man to lend money to. His first loan cycles aimed to improve his business as he intends to do now; he's intending to buy an air compressor that is necessary for his business. 

Youssef hopes to expand and improve his work as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor that is necessary for his business

loans.name: Alba De Jesús

texts.es:
En la calle Medardo Cevallos, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dr. Medardo Cevallos.

La señora Alba es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como presidenta del Banco,  dice que le gusta porque siempre han estado prestos para cualquier ayuda que necesitaba. Tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad, el menor vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la calle Medardo Cevallos, trabaja todos los días  desde las 6h30 hasta las 22h00, vende desde artículos de bazar, útiles escolares y bebidas alcohólicas, además los domingos en la mañana prepara y vende encebollados y en las noches vende cueritos asados,  dice que todo lo que es trabajo y deje ganancias es bueno y por eso lo hace.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería para surtir su tienda.
 
Su sueño es tener un mini market.
texts.en:
Every other week, group members of the Dr. Medardo Cevallos Community Bank get together on Medardo Cevallos Street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos since its colonization.

Mrs. Alba was the founding member of the community bank and she works very hard as its president. She says she likes it because there are always loans available to help with whatever she needs. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children. One child is already grown and the younger one lives with them. Her husband is a salesman.

She has a store in her home on Medardo Cevallos Street and she works every day from 6:30 am until 10:00 pm. She sells everything from tools to school supplies to alcoholic beverages and on Sunday mornings prepares and sells encebollados (a pork chop/onion dish) and in the evenings she sells grilled pork skins. She says that any kind of work that earns money is good and that is why she does it.

This loan is to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her dream is to have a mini-market.

loans.use: To buy supplies, merchandise, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is a resident of Arifwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its dairy industry. She lives in the housing colony named Al-Badar, in a two-room brick house with her family. 

She is 39 years of age and a widow who lost her husband a few years ago as the result of a sudden death. She survived that time with great difficulty, but she recovered her senses and started a grocery store adjacent to her home to fulfill the basic needs of her family. 

Recently she has started another business of selling clothes. She purchases the clothes from wholesale markets in different cities such as Lahore and Faisalabad and sells to her local area clients. She has five children, three daughters and two sons. All of them are attending school and studying in different classes. 

Muniran has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery shop business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk quantities and increase her sales. She is confident that her business will grow further after making this loan investment. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Muniran.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Dinah owns and operates a salon, which she has had for three years.

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dinah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Dinah hopes to own a plot. Dinah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her confidence and job skills.

loans.use: To purchase braids.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene seis hijos y con grado de instrucción de primaria incompleta.
Tiene un negocio de venta de carnes lo cual es trasladado desde Ilave hacia Ilo. Ella viene  trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es tener su local propio de carnicería.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es todo tipo de actividad realizada en la reunión.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Micaela Bastidas” community bank which is located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  She did not complete her primary education.

Margarita has a business selling meat which is moved from Ilave to Ilo.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she invested that money in her business.

Margarita is currently requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to have her own butcher's shop.

What she most likes about her community bank is all the activities which take place in the meetings.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her meat-selling business

loans.name: Malikahan's Group

texts.en: Malikahan A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a beautiful ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46 years old and divorced. She is bringing up a daughter and a son, both of whom are at school. In order to make money Malikahan prepares food and sells it. She started her business two years ago with the initial investment of 8,000 KGS, and now she earns about $86 per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for the rent of the building. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve the family's living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to pay for the rent

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 50 years old and single.  She lives with three dependents/siblings in their family house. Her family goal is to construct houses for renting.  Agnes is an employee of British American Tobacco and has been working there for 13 years. She hopes to retire and become self- employed in future. She wants the loan to build a house.

loans.use: To construct a house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 25 years and employs two farmhands. His main products are maize and tea, which he sells locally. He is also in the business of buying and selling cows at a local market.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to own a posho (cornmeal) mill that will help supplement his income. His biggest challenge has been low prices for his products, especially tea.

Joseph is 52 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 13 and 33. Two of his children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat lives in Mian Channu, a small city located in the Punjab, Pakistan and known for farming. She has lived in a two-room brick house with her family for the last 20 years. She is 42 years old, married to M. S. and has five children. Four of them study in different classes while oldest helps his father, who runs a business making school bags for students. Her husband’s shop is located in the market where he operates his business. He has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and has vast experience in his field of work. 

Riffat will use her portion of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband's business. He will use it to buy leather, thread and zippers in bulk, which will help him complete orders on time and earn more income. This is Riffat's second loan from Asasah; in her previous loan, she proved herself to be a responsible client by paying all of her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and zippers for a business making school bags for students.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina L. tiene 52 años, nacido en el distrito de San Miguel, es viuda y tiene 05 hijos;  viven en su casa propia, en la comunidad de Palmapampa anexo del Distrito de Samugari. Paulina, es el sostén de su familia; desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Paulina es campesina y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno en donde ha cultivado plantas de palillo, cacao, hojas de coca y barbasco; que son plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 23 años en sus propias tierras y aún le gusta su trabajo, y más cosechar, de esa manera siente que los meses de arduo trabajo tiene su recompensa y ver lo que cosecha son frutos de calidad. Sin embargo le resulta difícil transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este su noveno crédito de con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará fertilizantes e insecticidas para mejoras sus plantaciones y así obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Paulina L., 52, was born in San Miguel.  She’s a widow and has five children.  They live in their own house in the community of Palmapampa which is an annex in Samugari district.  

Paulina is the family breadwinner.  Since she was a little girl her parents taught her how to work the fields.  Paulina is a farmer and she has four hectares of land where she grows bamboo, cocoa beans, coca leaves and barbasco (a plant from which progesterone is synthesized), which are plants native to the jungle in the Apurimac River Valley.

She has been working her land for 23 years and she still enjoys the work, most of all harvesting, because that’s when she feels that the months of hard work are being rewarded and she sees that her harvest is composed of high quality products.  However, it is difficult to transport her crops from her fields to the city of San Francisco which is where the best prices are offered for her grains and coca leaves.

In the future she wants to buy new fields to increase her crops.  This is her 9th loan with MFP and she knows that if she repays on time she will be eligible for future loans more easily as well as not cause problems for her communal bank.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve her plantings thus obtaining good results.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married to M. S. and resides in Pakpattan, which is famous for its agriculture industry, in Pakistan. Her house is located in Peer kot, which is a small residential area of the city. She moved here with her family 20 years ago. 

Her husband operates a business of selling construction supplies. He provides his services to different construction companies on contract and also to his regular customers. 

Khursheed is a very skillful lady and an expert in embroidery works. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and prepares beautiful embroidered clothes. 

She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Her son works in a factory while her daughters are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy construction supplies in bulk to expand his business. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and has vast experience in this field. Khursheed is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business after utilizing the loan.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for selling

loans.name: Jane Mary

texts.en:
Jane Mary is 28 years old, married to Nzine,and a mother of three children who all schooling. She has been  farming in Mutongoni for a period of two years with an income of about $75 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings,and fertilizer. 


She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings& fertilizer

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer I. lives in the village of Erazgavors in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is blessed with a loving husband and three beautiful daughters (17, 21 and 23). She has been pleasantly pleased working with microfinance loans. Due to an illness she had to slaughter four of her pigs. Varditer would like a loan to purchase pigs and a bull. This investment will bring back the income level of the family. She dreams of seeing her daughters find their soulmates and live happy lives. Living in Erazgavors requires a lot of hard work but Varditer is satisfied and enjoys the support of her friends and relatives.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Kiyomidin

texts.en:
Kiyomidin lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. He is a responsible person who takes care of his family.  His wife is not working because she is looking after their children.  

Kiyomidin is engaged in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for 10 years. He purchases cattle from the market, fattens them, and sells them at a profit. He trades in the markets of Eganbay, Sultonobod, and Rudaki in Dushanbe city. Kiyomidin would like to get a loan of 7000 Somoni to purchase additional cattle and expand his business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is married to M. M. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Bari Rakho which is a residential area of the city. She moved here 9 years ago. 

Her husband has an animal-sales business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. 

Shamim is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives good number of orders every month. She also gives religious education to the children of her community. She has given birth to a son who is only one year old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy some goats and sheep to improve his business further. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Shamim hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him and earn him better profits.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.ru: Seymur G. 31 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Seymur yavlyayetsya IDP resonom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim bratom. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti materiali i t.d dlya remonta domov. Seymur uje 8 let kak rabotayet masterom domov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u dvoyurodnoqo brata.
texts.en: Seymur G. is 31 years old.  He is single and childless.  Seymur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Absheron region with his brother. He now needs 2300 AZN to buy tools and materials necessary for remodeling homes. Seymur has ben a home builder for eight years.  He started this business with his cousin.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 37-year-old, single woman living in the Sinkor Area. Regrettably, she dropped out of school in the third grade. She has four children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old: two live with her, while the other two live with her father. 

Cynthia started settling second-hand clothes in 1992. For example, she sells slippers and underwear (for both ladies and gentlemen) to her customers. 

Cynthia is now requesting a loan to purchase additional slippers and underwear. In the future, she hopes to live to see her children receive a better education than she did.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing items (e.g., slippers and underwear)

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernadette, aged 46, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Adonai Plus”. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bernadette has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1992. She runs a restaurant. Her business is located to the western part of Kinshasa. She has been a faithful Hope client, having seven times obtained and properly repaid loans. Since then, her business has prospered.The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to diversify her business by purchasing 80 crates of soft drink for resale with the goal of increasing her profits. 

Her business generates a profit of about $25 per day. Bernadette’s ambition is to become a soft drink provider in her environment. She is married and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 18 and 32 years old. Two of them attend school

loans.use: to diversify her business by purchasing 80 crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La señora Sabina tiene un puesto de comida donde vende almuerzos y platos extras. El crédito lo requiere para la compra insumos como ser: Fideos, arroz, condimentos, carne, etc., para así satisfacer a su clientela. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Sabina cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito pasa a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sabina has a food stand where she sells lunch and other meals. The loan she is requesting is to purchase ingredients such as pasta, rice, condiments, meat, etc. so that she can satisfy her customers. She lives in her own home that is located in the Alto Irpavi zone in the city of La Paz. She is a widow and has one son.

Sabina is very happy with the loans she has received because they allowed her to improve and increase her working capital. This is the third time she will receive a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pasta, rice, meat, and vegetables for her food-sales stand

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 38 years old and has one son. Analyn is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 9 years now. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. They also earn extra income by transporting passengers to different barangays of Sta. Josefa.

This loan will help Analyn buy the farm supplies she needs like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Analyn hopes to manage a bigger farm and to be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy the farm supplies she needs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Eynulla

texts.en:
Eynulla is 46 years old.  He is married and has four children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling sheep and large livestock at the local market. Every year he buys lambs and sheep from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his sons and then sells sheep and furs to local butchers or in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is about 300 USD.

Eynulla is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present herd is not sufficient to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more sheep, lambs and fodder. To do so, he needs to invest an additional 1000 AZN in his business.  We believe his 10 years of experience and deep knowledge of his business will bring him success.

loans.use: to purchase eight lambs and fodder

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador de 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad comercio, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Amador es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra arroz, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y así puede obtener mayores ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar semillas, fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y pago de mano de obra, con la finalidad de ofertar su producto a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Amador es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Amador, 48, lives with his family in his own house which only has electricity and is located in Oyotún District which belongs to Chiclayo Province, an area noted for commerce, farming, raising livestock and tourism.

Amador is a farmer.  He has his own fields where he grows rice.  Once it’s harvested he sells it in various markets in Chiclayo in order to obtain higher income and be able to cover his household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy seed and fertilizer to improve his land’s productivity with the aim in mind of being able to sell his products for a higher price and thus improve economically.  Amador is a father who is concerned that his family improves and that his children have other opportunities in the near future.
.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa processes palm oil and palm kernel oil in Elmina, in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. With the assistance of her spouse, school fees and utility bills are paid. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits, from which she will make palm oil. She will also use the nuts for palm kernel oil. She anticipates reinvesting the additional profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make palm oil and palm kernel oil.

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señorita Gloria, tiene 37 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de su mamá a pesar de que tiene su casa propia que aun no termina por completo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja de lunes a viernes de 16h00 hasta las 19h00 ya que a esta hora encuentra siempre a sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Huaquillas cada vez que necesita. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es terminar por completo  su casa.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ciudad Alfraro Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

This is the place where Gloria, age 37, lives.  She is single, and she lives in her mother’s house in spite of the fact that she has her own house that is still not completely finished.

She sells all types of clothes door to door.  She also sells at home, where her customers come when she has new merchandise.  She works Monday through Friday from 4:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. because this is when she always finds her customers.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  Each time she needs merchandise she goes to Huaquillas to buy it.  She has been doing this business activity for seven years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles.  She likes it because of the help that is given with the loans.

Her dream is to completely finish her house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband is a vegetable seller and is the only breadwinner in the family. Mumtaz is the mother of five children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education.  

It is very difficult for Mumtaz and her husband to afford the living and education expenses of their children, and that’s why her husband wants to improve his vegetable selling business for which reason Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell to his customers. He has a good experience in his business and Mumtaz is confident that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married and has two children. Rosario is 48 years old and lives in Corales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling most of the basic necessities for a household. She has run the business for over five years. Every month, she gets approximately PHP 3,000 from store operations.

Her husband is a motorcycle driver.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a large number of products to sell.

Rosario has been a member of GDMPC since 2005.  All previous loans she took out from the cooperative were repaid in full. This is her 11th loan request. 

In the future, Rosario hopes to expand and improve her product offerings to gain more income and sustain business operations.

loans.use: To buy a large number of products to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES. With the loan she is taking, she wants to venture into another business of making fruit juice for sale. She wants to purchase sacks of fruits for the juice making business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers needs and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits for making fruit juices for sale.

loans.name: Olmedys

texts.es: La señora Olmedys  es cliente nueva de la institución vive en la zona de Rosas Aní, vive  en alquiler  tiene un pequeño hijo y también cuida a su mamá ya que ella se encuentra delicada de salud la Sra. Olmedys tiene un almacén de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, ella tiene mucha clientela por el buena atención que brinda, esta es la única fuente de  ingresos para la manutención de su familia  ella es responsable y trabajadora,  solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda,  como dulces galletas, refrescos, etc. Ella trabaja mucho ya que tiene el deseo de comprar la casa y poder dejar algo a su hijita.
texts.en: Señora Olmedys is a new member of the institution and lives in Rosas Ani. She lives in rented premises and has a small child. She also takes care of her mother as she is in a delicate state of health. Señora Olmedys has a neighbourhood store where she sells staple products. She has a lot of customers as she offers excellent service. This is the sole source of income for the upkeep of her family. She is responsible and hardworking. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store such as sweets, cookies, beverages, etc. She works hard as she really wants to buy a house to be able to bequeath her small daughter something.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, beverages and cookies to stock her store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
His name sounds like a girl's name. Joy is 33 years old, married with two school-aged children. He is lucky to be married to a teacher named Nory. Joy is a farmer in the Philippines. He has been running a rice farming business for almost 16 years. With his expertise in farming, Joy earns an average income of P40,000 per crop.

Despite hindrances he encounters in farming, like calamities and pests, Joy still prefers to continue his business because it is the primary source of income of the family. Joy wants to get a better yield for every crop. He visits his farm every other day to assure that his crop is in good condition.

Joy is requesting a loan of P35,000 to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and to pay for the labor of land preparation. He hopes to used the loan wisely and that it will help him to provide the farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and to pay for the labor of land preparation.

loans.name: Mungoma

texts.en:
Mungoma is 39 years old, married and a father of two children. He has repaired bicycles for the last 7 years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy spare parts, spanners, tubes and grease.

He will save the anticipated profits and provide for the basic needs of his family. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a garage.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, spanners, tubes, and grease.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

Joyce sells charcoal on retail basis at the market, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She works seven days a week. 

Joyce is requesting a loan for 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goal is to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Unidad De Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El comité "Unidas de Santa Clara" surgió a través de una promoción que se realizó en la zona. Las integrantes viven en el mismo barrio y se conocen hace tiempo, por lo que ya han hecho una buena amistad. Ellas tienen por objetivos fomentar el espiritu emprendedor, la solidaridad y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de la fundación.
Mirta es una de las miembros, nos comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de confites de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien. Dice que gracias a sus buenas manos con los dulces es que le va muy bien. Comenta que hace confites para todo tipo de eventos y gracias a eso se ha hecho muy conocida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, huevos, manteca y demás ingredientes para la elaboración de confites. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The "Unidas de Santa Clara" communal bank came about through an outreach campaign that was carried out in the area. The members live in the same neighborhood, and have known each other for some time, so they have already formed a good friendship. They have as their objectives: promoting an enterprising spirit, mutual support, and reaching the highest level of the Foundation's program.  

Mirta is one of the members. She says that she makes sweets of all kinds, and that it is going very well. She says that she makes the sweets for all kinds of events, and thanks to that she has become very well known. She is asking for the loan to buy flour, eggs, lard, and the rest of the ingredients for making sweets.

She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, lard, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 44 years old and engaged in a farming business. He is already four years in operating this occupation. It is a difficult task, he said because it requires staying the whole day under the sun to cultivate, plow and plant.  Nevertheless, he stands strong and patiently works because it helps a lot to improve their status of living.

As of now, he is asking for a loan amount P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used to his farming business. Through this loan he could develop his business and yields better crops. By this matter, he could then save for the education of his five children and secure his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used to his farming business

loans.name: Wangoni

texts.en:
Wangoni is a married man with two children who are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past two years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. Wangoni dreams of expanding his business and establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Johnny, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado y vive con su esposa e hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal, como lo son los abonos y herbicidas. El actualmente cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y además de tener ya varios años de experiencia para el buen manejo del cultivo. Él le hará una mejora a la plantación de café que posee para así obtener los mejores resultados de esta. El tienen como meta generar una muy buena cosecha para así venderla y obtener uno buenos ingresos para mejorar su bienestar y su estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Johnny is 46 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. 

He plans to use the money from the loan to buy supplies to care for his coffee plantation, such as compost and herbicides. 

Currently he has the land ready for cultivating and furthermore he has some years experience knowing how to manage the crop. He will make improvements to the coffee plantation in order to have the best results. He has as a goal to harvest a better crop to sell to obtain a good profit to improve his wellbeing and his financial standing. 

This is the first loan that he has received through Fudecosur. He has not had other loans before from the state banks, but Fudecosur has given the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to care for his coffee plantation, such as compost and herbicides

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His current business is farming which he started ten years ago. He grows coffee and pineapples. His challenges have been price fluctuations, inflation, an unreliable labour force and rats destroying the pineapples that are ready to be taken to market.

His dream is to educate himself and children and buy more land to grow crops. Vincent needs the loan to buy coffee seeds to plant.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds to plant.

loans.name: Cynthia Melchorita

texts.es:
Cynthia es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y su pequeño bebé recién nacido, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante con su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para su bebé; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Cynthia no pudo terminar sus estudios primarios, tampoco ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su bebé y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cynthia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Cynthia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Cynthia tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y un puesto de ventas en el centro de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a 21-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and her small, recently-born baby. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her effort to getting ahead with her small son, since she is her baby's mother and father. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work since she was very young, Cynthia was unable to finish her primary school studies, nor has she been able to study for the professional nursing degree that she wanted, but she would like to do so.

In her free time she likes to play with her baby and on some occasions cook a delicious "Frejoles con Seco" dish (A Peruvian meat, bean and rice dish) to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Cynthia works in her small store selling groceries and candy. She works every day for approximately 12 hours and believes it is going well for her due to the good prices and friendly treatment she offers to her clients.

Cynthia is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer, she will be able to purchase a larger quantity and variety of products such as rice, sugar, milk, beans, sweets, candy, soda and more. Thus, Cynthia will have her business better stocked and will be able to attend to more clients. 

In this way, she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own house and a sales booth in the city center.

loans.use: to buy grocery store products

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie is a businesswoman from Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 31 years old, married and has a business of raising pigs. She has smoothly run this kind of business for years and is happy to take a loan from PMPC. Now, she is asking for a loan to purchase additional heads of pigs to raise. Lorie hopes to maintain her membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of pigs to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman from the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 53 years old and a mother of six children; four adults and two-school- aged. She and her husband earn a living by doing fishing business. They have been doing this livelihood for almost 40 years to support the needs of their children and able to provide food for the family. Josephine’s only goal in life is to sustain and have enough money to send her school-aged children to college. She wants them to finished their degree and become professionals someday. Josephine needs an amount to buy fishing net and new engine for their fishing boat. That is why, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans. In this way, she and her husband will be able to continue use their fishing boat and able to improve their catch for a living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and new engine for their fishing boat

loans.name: Horacio

texts.en:
The young and entrepreneurial Horacio has always distinguished himself as being a very hard working person and devoted to his parents, whom are his role models. Ever since he was little, they taught him about honest work and responsibility, virtues that he has adopted for himself. Horacio manages his own business, a taco stand. He started it 6 years ago after the mechanic\'s shop where he worked closed down. He found himself in need to find his own way of supporting himself and his parents. This is how he started with his business, with the support of some of his family members.

Thanks to his business, Horacio has been able to help his family. Today he requires a loan in the amount of $475, which he plans to repay in a term of 6 months. He needs you and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his parents. Do not leave them alone, and become part of the development of his small business. Horacio will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven y emprendedor Horacio siempre se ha distinguido por ser una persona muy trabajadora y apegada a sus padres, quienes son su ejemplo a seguir, ya que desde pequeño le han enseñado el trabajo honrado y responsable que le siempre ha adoptado para si. Horacio tiene un negocio propio, se trata de un puesto de tacos, mismo que inició hace 6 años, después de de que el taller en que trabajaba como mecánico cerró y el se vio en la necesidad de buscar su propia forma de manutención y ayudar a sus padres para que salieran adelante, por lo que decidió comenzar con esta actividad, con el apoyo de algunos familiares.

Gracias a este proyecto Horacio ha podido ayudar a su familia, ahora el requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 6 meses. El te necesita y con tu generosidad puedes ayudarlo a crecer y a que el pueda continuar ayudando a su padres, no lo dejes solos y forma parte importante de su desarrollo microempresarial, Horacio te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zabil

texts.en:
Zabil is a single man who breeds calves. 
He started this business 5 years ago. This 28-year-old young man lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. Now he needs a loan of $700 to buy 4 calves to fatten.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves to fatten

loans.name: Dr. Kigoonya

texts.en:
Dr. W. is a general practitioner managing his own private facility in Machakos, Kenya. He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He trained as a medical doctor from 1974 to 1979 and initially worked with the government for 10 years.

In 1989 Dr. W. set up his own clinic in Machakos town (pictured). He offers a wide range of services including general curative services, family planning, and maternal and child health services. He also runs a pharmacy, a laboratory, and a theatre.

Dr. W. attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and assistance from KMET’s previous two microfinance loans. He needs another US $1200 to purchase stocks of drugs and integrate other services into his facility.

loans.use: Expand medical clinic.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalila is a married mother of two children, students ages 15 and 17. Her husband worked at his father's printing shop, where he learned the trade. To cover household expenses and afford their children's education, Dalila and her husband decided to start their own business offering printing and bookbinding services. They started doing small jobs out of their home, and very soon they obtained many more clients thanks to the high quality of their services.

Dalila and her husband want to see their business continue to grow, and to achieve this they are requesting a loan of $925, which they will use to purchase computer equipment to improve the quality of their designs and printings. They hope this will increase their production and improve the services they offer. Dalila plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are sincerely grateful for your support and confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dalila es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Su esposo trabajaba ayudando a su padre en su propia imprenta, ahí es donde aprendió el oficio y para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos entre Dalila y su esposo decidieron iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de impresión y encuadernación. Comenzaron realizando pequeños trabajos en su hogar, y poco después gracias a la buena calidad de sus servicios lograron tener muchos más clientes.

Dalila y su esposo desean que su negocio continúe creciendo y para esto necesitan un préstamo de $ 925 dólares con los que comprará equipo de cómputo para mejorar la calidad de diseño e impresión, con esto esperan incrementar su producción y mejorar el servicio que ofrecen, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Dalila y su familia agradecen sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que depositas en ellos.

loans.use: Purchase computer equipment

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen's entrepreneurial and optimistic spirit have helped her and her family overcome many financial difficulties that have arisen in their household. For some time now, she has learned to cope with the arduous responsibility entailed by the education of her three children. With the goal of bettering the quality of her family's life, she started a small business selling wallets and briefcases in which she places all of her efforts. Nonetheless, she still has many limitations to fully develop this activity because of numerous orders she has taken and not been able to fulfill due to lack of capital. For that reason, she hopes to increase her inventory to cover a variety of orders, and rent a space to offer them in a permanent fashion. By expanding her business, she will have greater returns that will allow her to efficiently contribute the unconditional support that she provides her little ones. In order to achieve these goals, she asks for the sum of $275 and extends her commitment to pay back during the course of 6 months. Lets contribute so that Carmen's dreams can become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

El espíritu emprendedor y optimista de Carmen la han ayudado a ella y a su familia a superar muchas dificultades económicas que surgen en casa. Hace tiempo ha aprendido a sobrellevar la ardua responsabilidad que genera la educación de tres hijos.Con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida familiar inició un pequeño negocio de comercialización de carteras y maletines en el que ha puesto y pone todo su esfuerzo; sin embargo aún tiene muchas limitaciones para desarrollar plenamente esta actividad debido a los innumerables pedidos que recepciona y no ha podido cumplir en un 100%por falta de capital; por ello que desea incrementar su inversión para cubrir la variedad de pedidos y alquilar un espacio para ofrecerlos de manera permanente. Al ampliar su negocio podrá obtener mayor rentabilidad y de esta manera contribuirá eficazmente con el apoyo incondicional que le brinda a sus pequeños. Para cumplir este deseo solicita la suma de 275 dólares y les extiende su compromiso de devolución en un lapso de 6 meses. Contribuyamos para que los sueños de Carmen puedan convertirse en una realidad.

loans.use: Increase capital to acquire inventory and rental space in which to sell her products

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio A. is married, has one adopted daughter and runs a successful tailoring shop with his wife.

He began working with the Foundation Paraguay nearly 10 years ago. In that time, he has received several loans which he used to buy cloth, yarn, thread, buttons, zippers, notions and other items that he needs to make clothing for men and women. There is strong demand for these products in the markets in Limpio and Luque, small towns just outside of Paraguay´s capital city, Asuncion. That's why Patricio has come to us for a new loan of $225 for additional materials he needs to make more clothing for his customers.

We are confident that he will repay the loan because of his work with us in the past. In addition, his daughter is also a client of the foundation -- and through their hard work and careful use of loans received from the foundation, the family has been able to build a good life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, thread, zippers and other items

loans.name: Kolopa

texts.en: Kolopa is on her second loan. She is doing well with her business, and she is asking for this loan to buy supplies she needs at this stage. Otherwise, she is able to sustain the business with the profits she makes from the sale of ice cakes. She hopes to expand to other products soon, but for now she plans to stick to the production and sale of ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) until she makes enough profit to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Namungoona A Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Annet owns a butcher shop. She wants to use the extra profits to expand her business and repay the loan. Aisha and Robinah are both poultry farmers. They want to buy more poultry feeds. Edtih has a beauty salon and wants to buy hair oils and weaves. Aisha is a food vendor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women want to expand and improve their businesses.

loans.name: Nakulyaku East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Glades M.. She is currently in the business of running a butchery and is requesting a loan to boost business. Glades is 47 years old and is married. She has 1 child who goes to school. Each week, Glades makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child and build better premises for her business. Glades has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Glades is joined in her small group by Olivia B., Olivia N. and Mariam N.. Olivia B. has a business in maize milling and wants to increase the stock of maize. Olivia N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Mariam N. operates a retail shop business and wants to add capital.

loans.use: To add more capital to butchery business

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Since she was a little girl, Nora’s aspiration has been to succeed in life. Those plans were postponed for many months, however, with the arrival of her loving son being that she faced this responsibility on her own. Now that her son is older and does not require as much care and attention, she can effectively dedicate her time to her work. She sells clothing, and buys and sells CD’s. With these two activities she manages to maintain her loving family, which consists of her small son and her elderly parents, without economic restraint. Observing and analyzing the great demand for DVD’s and CD’s that exists in the market, she decided to do this work full-time because she believes that this activity will generate a higher income for her family. Your good heart will help this young mother achieve her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La aspiración de Nora desde niña fue la de tener éxito en la vida, pero esos planes se postergaron durante muchos meses con la llegada de su querido hijo, puesto que se encontraba sola para enfrentar esta responsabilidad, ahora que su niño se encuentra grande y no necesita tantos cuidados y atenciones ya puede desenvolverse eficazmente en su trabajo. Comercializa prendas de vestir y compra y vende de CDs, con estas dos actividades está logrando mantener sin limitaciones económicas a su querida familia que la integran su pequeño niño y sus ancianos padres.Viendo y analizando la gran demanda de DVDs Y CDs que existe en el mercado decidió dedicarse íntegramente a este negocio, porque considera que con esta actividad podrá generar mayores ingresos económicos a su familia.Tu buen corazón permitirá que esta joven madre cumpla sus objetivos en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer CD's and DVD's in greater quantities.

loans.name: Johari

texts.id:
Johari is a responsible father to his family. Even in the tough economic situation, Johari can survive it because he has skill in building raft so he is now making use of this skill. Furthermore, currently quite many people need rafts so his business can go well. Johari started the business with the initial capital of Rp. 500,000, however, since the business has become bigger, it is not enough for buying the raw materials (bamboo). Moreover, the price of bamboo is increasing because of its high demand. When he can't buy bamboo, he orders raft from Jawa, then he modifies the size as requested by his customers in Bali. Fortunately, Dinari foundation is willing to give him a loan so that Johari can continue the business. This business is his only source of income, while his wife is a full-time housewife who doesn't earn money at all. A raft made of bamboo skin can be sold for Rp. 450,000, and a raft made of bamboo can be sold for Rp. 300,000. With the loan from Dinari, Johan hopes that his business can grow and he can earn more profit so that he can afford his children's education fee and his family's life expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Johari seorang bapak yang sangat bertanggung jawab terhadap kehidupan keluarganya. Dalam menghadapi situasi ekonomi seperti ini Johari tetap bisa bertahan karena ia memiliki ketrampilan dibidang menganyam bedeg,sehingga ketrampilan itu sekarang dikembangkan. Apalagi sekarang ini yang memerlukan bedek lumayan banyak sehingga usaha ini bisa dikembangkan terus. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.500.000 Johari menekuni usaha ini, namun sejalan dengan berkembangnya usaha ini dan banyak yang mulai mengenal hasil anyaman Johari maka modal awal tidak lagi mencukupi untuk membeli bahan baku yaitu bambu. Apalagi sekarang harga bambu mulai meningkat ,karena banyaknya yang mencari,sehingga kesempatan bagi pemilik bambu untuk bisa menaikan harga . Dan kalau tidak dapat membeli bambu maka Johari akan mendatangkan bedek yang sudah jadi dari Jawa,kemudian sampai di Bali bedeg tersebut disambung sesuai dengan ukuran yang diminta oleh si pemesan.Untungnya ada Yayasan Dinari yang memberikan pinjaman modal ,sehingga Johari bisa tetap meneruskan usaha ini. Karena usaha inilah satu-satunya matapencaharian bagi Johari dan keluarga,sedangkan istrinya tidak mempunyai pekerjaan yang bisa menunjang keuangan keluarga. Satu lembar bedeg yang terbuat dari kulit bambu bisa dijual seharga Rp.450.000, sedangkan kalau bedeg yang terbuat dari bambu bagian dalam hanya bisa terjual seharga Rp.300.000. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Johari berharap usahanya dapat terus berjalan dan berkembang dan keuntungan yang diperoleh pun bisa meningkat sehingga anak-anaknya dapat bersekolah dan kehidupan keluarga dapat terjamin.

loans.use: To buy raw material (bamboo)

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
Olga Luz is a member of the community bank Las Almendras, located at Jr. Agustin Cauper 458 in the district of Calleria of the province of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband is a maize transporter, but the income isn’t sufficient to support the family. So Olga decided to invest in clothing sales with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles.

Presently she attends to multiple orders made by her clients and she travels constantly to be able to acquire products of very good quality. In the mornings, she’s dedicated to domestic jobs, and in the afternoons she goes out to offer her products.

With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be paid back in five months, she will buy: clothes, perfumes, bracelets, necklaces, undergarments, etc.

Olga feels very happy because she is proudly helping her family move forward and with the loans that she receives, she knows that she will invest them very well.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Olga Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. Agustín Cauper 458, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es estibador de maíz, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Olga con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropas.

En la actualidad para poder atender los múltiples pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, viaja constantemente para poder traer sus productos de muy buena calidad, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas, y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas, perfumes, aretes, collares, ropas interiores, etc.

Olga se siente feliz, contenta por que esta saliendo adelante para el orgullo de su familia con los prestamos que recibe sabe invertirlos muy bien y progresar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is a woman who has creativity and talent in her hands. From the time she was a child, she showed great interest in learning how to make these beautiful handicrafts. At the urging of various friends and neighbors, she is currently taking handicraft classes where she is learning to make a great variety of decorations for the kitchen, bedrooms, and other uses. Mariela works hard with the goal of saving enough to open a small store for her handicrafts. The decorations that she designs and makes with the help of her beloved daughter, Anita, who is ten years old, allow her to cover satisfactorily the household expenses. She has many projects in mind—projects that, with your help, she hopes to carry out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela, es una mujer que tiene creatividad y talento en las manos, desD. niña demostró tener gran interés por aprender a realizar estos hermosos trabajos D. manualidades; actualmente por solicitud D. algunas amistades y vecinos viene dictando diferentes cursos D. manualidades, cursos donD. elaboran gran variedad D. adornos para cocina, dormitorios y uso personal, Mariela trabaja arduamente con el fin D. ahorrar lo suficiente y abrir su tiendita D. manualidades. Los adornos que diseña y elabora con apoyo D. su querida hija Anita D. 10 años D. edad le está permitiendo cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos D. su hogar, y tiene muchos proyectos en mente, proyectos que espera con tu apoyo concretarlos.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can soon open her handicrafts store

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja tiene 37 años de edad , estudio hasta sexto de primaria , habla aymará y poco castellano , es madre soltera tiene una hija que esta estudiando en el colegio del distrito de Unicachi . su domicilio cuenta con luz, agua, esta ubicada en barrio Lajje del distrito de Unicachi . Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal San Pedro de Unicachi. Se dedica a la venta de mallas de diferentes medidas, que ella adquiere por paquete de 1200 kilos , los cuales vienen en retazos muy grandes que ella los cose con hilo numero 12 alquitranado y lo vende por metros o kilos a los compradores que vienen de Bolivia, Yunguyo; con este negocio esta hace 8 años. Su hermana menor es la principal proveedora de la mercadería porque ella lo trae desde lima, también vende a las demás personas que se dedican a este negocio. Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mallas al por mayor. En fechas nos dice que se reúnen todas y comparten un plato que ellas mismas preparan, aprendió y dice que las mujeres podemos trabajar. Ella recibe el poyo de su hermana que viaja a Lima. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es comercializar malla por mayor viajar a Lima y que su hija sea profesional.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Mrs. Maruja is a 37 year old woman who studied up until 6th grade, speaks Aymara and some Spanish, and is a single mother with a daughter who is studying in a high school in Unicachi. Her home has water and electricity and is located in the Lajje neighborhood of the Unicachi district. She belongs to the Banco Comunal San Pedro de Unicachi and works selling cloth in different sizes. She buys it in packages of 1200 kilograms each and then she sews them by hand and sells the cloth by meters or kilos to buyers who come from Bolivia and Yunguyo. She has been doing this for 8 years. Her younger daughter is the principal provider of the merchandise since she brings it from Lima; she also sells to other people who work in this same business. With her loan of 1500 soles (which will be paid off in 4 installments) she will buy more cloth at a wholesale price. She also receives help from her sister in Lima. Her ultimate dream is to commercialize the sale of this cloth and also be able to support her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: Puchase of cloth at wholesale price

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn L. (49) is a widow with five adopted children: three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters works in a restaurant, and the other one is a silk weaver. One of her sons is a ferryboat worker, the second is a monk, and the third studies in a local school. All of her children also help her in the farming business. Torn and her children live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Torn has been a silk weaver for thirty years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides her weaving business, she grows rice as well. She needs the money to continue her existing business and repair the broken part of her house.

She is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice. The remainder of the money she will use to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving, grow rice and repair part of her house.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 27 years old and has two children. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and took out a loan to invest in raising livestock, but this business was not very profitable. Being resourceful and flexible, she switched to the Internet access business, and since this service was new in her area, it became successful. Additional family income comes from Tran’s husband, a driver.

Currently, the demand for Internet access by local people is increasing, so Tran is requesting a loan of $1100 to buy computers to expand her business. With her income of over $185 per month, she is confident that she will have enough money to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Julia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Julia es artesana, realiza bellos tejidos a mano con palitos, bordados, como chompas, gorros, carteras, teniendo como materia prima la lana de alpaca natural y procesado, actividad que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de 18 mujeres, todas ellas conforman una asociación de mujeres Awaq, sus ventas los realizan a empresas y trabajan a pedidos.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores. Los sueños de Julia son exportar sus productos directamente, tener una empresa más grande y todas las socias mejoren la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ollantay Community Bank. Julia is married, is 50 years old, and has 5 children. Julia is a craftswoman, producing beautiful fabrics by hand with sticks and borders, such as sweaters, hats, wallets, using natural and processed wool from alpacas as a raw material. She does this is her home with the help of 18 women, all of whom belong to an association for women, Awaq. They sell their goods to businesses and work for orders.

Julia needs a loan of 1650 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of different colors of wool. Julia dreams of exporting her products directly, having a bigger business, and that all of the members will improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1650 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of different colors of wool

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Mr. Luis Alfonso S. E. is 48 years old and he is married. Mr. Luis has three children, of whom two don’t depend on him. He has a young daughter, who is 3 years old and is not in school. His partner, Ruth de los Ángeles Rojas, works in a preschool. She also provides support to her family. His dreams are that he doesn’t lack work since he needs to provide his family with food every day. His other dreams are to set up his own workshop with his tools because this would give him more clients. He also wants to have a fixed location where the workshop can be located and to have a space where he can receive his clients and offer better service.

He repairs and paints automobiles; he has been in this business for 30 years. Mr. Luis began this business as an assistant in a mechanic workshop where he was able to learn about the different jobs that a mechanic does. What attracted his attention, though, was repairing and painting automobiles. As time passed, he succeeded in specializing in these tasks and, as a result, he decided to spend his life doing this work. He carried this out through service at home. He will use this loan for capital for work that he will use to purchase tools. This is feasible for him because the tools will be purchased in Managua. Thus he will be able to provide employees to the different assistants that he needs for the completion of different jobs.
texts.en:
El señor de nombre Luis Alfonso S. E. su edad es de 48 años su estado civil es acompañado, Don Luis tiene tres hijos de los cuales 2 varones no dependen de el solo su hija menor que tiene 3 años de edad y que no estudia, su compañera de vida de nombre Ruth De los Ángeles Rojas labora en un jardín de infancia y ella también proporciona su aportación a su familia, sus deseos son que el trabajo no le falte ya que Don Luis necesita de el para darle a su familia el alimento de cada día, otros de sus deseos es instalar su propio taller con sus respectivas herramientas por lo que esto le daría mayor afluencia de clientes y obtener un lugar fijo donde localizarlo y tener su espacio donde pueda recibir a sus clientes y brindar un mejor servicio. Su actividad económica es enderezar y pintar automóviles, el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 30 años, Don Luis inicia este negocio como ayudante en un taller de mecánica donde podía educarse en los diferentes oficios que tiene la mecánica, pero la que atrajo su atención fue la de enderezar y pintar automóviles y al paso del tiempo el logra destacarse en esta en particular y es así como decide implementarlo en su vida como un medio de trabajo y lo desempeña a través del servicio a domicilio, por lo que corresponde este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado en la compra de equipos de sus herramientas ya que la compra se realiza en Managua pues esta resulta mas factible para el y así poder proporcionar empleos a los diferentes ayudantes que el necesita para la realización de los diferentes trabajos.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em H. is 30 years old and makes a living raising pigs at her home, which she sells to a slaughterer six months after raising them. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Provice, and has one young child. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Paiy, age 33, is a local farmer. Em needs to ask for a loan to purchase two oxen for her husband to plow a field, and four piglets to raise. (She and her husband are in the picture.)

loans.use: To purchase two oxen, and four piglets

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy Phay is a villager in Khna Rong Village in Takeo Province. She is a tailor in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Nhanh Phai, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family.

To deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthy Phay decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business, and then she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows. Mrs. Chanthy Phay is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. The child is two years old. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Miss Pratima R. lives in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur and is a tailor. She opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took a six-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses such as the Kurta Sulwar which are very popular with Nepali women. She makes dresses according to orders she gets from her customers. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10,000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

She lives with her father, mother, one brother and one sister. Her father is a laborer in house construction work. Both her brother and sister are now studying.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Shama Begum Haji M. Tufail Group
loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet L. grows rice and vegetables. She tills her 15-hectare land to easily feed and clothe her family. She is 44 years old and has five children. Her husband, Fernando L., is helping her manage their business. They dream to send all their children to college. With the help of CEVI credit assistance, they will be able to sustain their business and achieve higher yields.
