She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. In this way, she could ensure a quality harvest of her farm.

CEVI helps people to start and have a business. Like Juliet, other CEVI clients also receive not only credit assistance but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mèvi Sidéméto

texts.fr: Madame A. mèvi sidéméto  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé un quartier nord de la ville de Lomé, depuis 2005 elle a entamée le commerce de produits génériques, son stock de marchandises est complètement épuisé pour y remédier elle sollicite un second crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 lot de produits génériques, ce crédit sera son second car elle a déjà obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a très bien remboursé. Elle est mariée et ils ont 01 enfant à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Mèvi Sidéméto is a resident of Agoè Assiyéyé, a district in northern Lomé. In 2005, she started doing commerce in generic pharmaceutical products. Her inventory is completely exhausted. To remedy the situation, she’s requesting a second WAGES loan to buy an order of pharmaceuticals. This loan will be her second one because she already obtained one before that was indeed repaid. She is married, and they have one child to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Ayomide

texts.en: Ayomide is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions, weavons, and rents VCD's. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions, weavons, and VCD's. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, weavons, and VCD's

loans.name: Leomar

texts.en:
Leomar operates a tricycle transport in his village, which serves as his source of income. He is now 29 years old, married to Maricel, and lives in the village of Alibago Enrile, Cagayan. They are blessed with two children: Mary Heart, 7 years old, already in first grade, and Maria Kathleen, 4 years old, who will enter Kindergarten in June 2009. 

His wife is busy with her small-hog raising business and this adds to their income. Leomar works hard as a tricycle driver in order to provide his family with good living conditions. But his income is not enough to provide all their basic needs and maintain the general repair of his tricycle. Therefore, he wishes a loan of Php 5,000.00. The loan he requests will be used for general maintenance on the tricycle that he uses for public transportation. Leomar and his wife work hand in hand in order to save their income for their children’s future. His dreams of having a comfortable living for his family motivate him to double his time in generating a daily income that will satisfy their needs and eventually will be a big help towards reaching his goals in life.

loans.use: To make general repairs on his motorcycle

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 38 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business is sales of daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Crisy

texts.en:
Crisy B. is from the town of Villa Victoria, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Crisy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop and does RTW clothing sales.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and RTW in the local community. Crisy has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Crisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and for the family's basic needs.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.en: K. Davlatmurod is 20 years old. He is not married and helps his parents with the family expenses. Davlatmurod has been the owner of a small general store for more than three years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as flour, sugar, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets (candies), etc. His motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock his business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family. Support this young and energetic guy of much strength and courage to keep working. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Mafalda

texts.pt:
Mafalda N. nasceu em Gaza tem 43 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 13 aos 25 anos de idade todos vão a escola somente a filha do meio é que já esta empregada na educação.

Mafalda sai de Gaza para o Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira de Suazilândia ainda criança com seu pai este que era trabalhador das águas da Namaacha (MONTEMOR), este que vem perder a vida durante o horário de trabalho. Sendo assim a empresa cede trabalho para um dos seus filhos, sendo a mais velha teve a oportunidade de trabalhar para ajudar no sustento da família. Hoje e funcionaria permanente a mais de 24 anos trabalhando em turnos das 7:00 as 15:30h no período da manhã e das 15:30 as 23:0h no período da noite, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 2.129.00MT, valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades, pois vive numa casa de aluguer pagando mensalmente 500.00MT. Mas com ajuda do seu esposo este que trabalha como guarda fronteira, eles conseguem colectar um fundo e ambos dão inicio da obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não conseguem concluir, então o esposo teve que pedir um empréstimo de 34.000.00MT numa instituição bancaria (BIM) para dar continuidade da mesma que também não e concluída. numa conversa com seus colegas de serviço teve conhecimento dos nossos serviços e aproxima pedindo um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes e de seguida mudar se para sua própria casa, para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza não responsabiliza se por ninguém. Tem um grande sonho de se casar oficialmente e ser 

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Mafalda na Hluvuku e Kiva, estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para comprar aros da porta e janelas e as suas respectivas fechaduras, esta muito feliz, pois dentro em breve vai viver na sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para os preparativos do seu futuro casamento.
texts.en:
Mafalda N. was born in Gaza. She is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has five children between the ages of 13 and 25. They are all in school except the middle daughter, who is already employed in education. Mafalda and her father left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland while she was still a child. Her father worked at the Montemor mineral water company, and died on the job. The company then hired one of his children, and since she was the eldest she had the opportunity to work to help support her family. Today she has been an employee there for 24 years, alternating between a day shift from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and a night shift from 3:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. She earns 2129 meticals a month, not enough to cover her basic expenses, since she lives in a rental house that costs 500 meticals a month. But with the help of her husband, who works as a border guard, they manage to scrape by. Because of the high cost of construction materials they have not been able to finish building their house. Her husband had to apply for a 34,000-metical loan from a bank (BIM) to continue the work, and it still remains unfinished. She learned about our services in a conversation with coworkers, and came to us to request a loan of 10,000 meticals to finish part of the house and be able to move into their own home. Apart from her children, she is not financially responsible for anybody else. She has big dreams of getting married officially and being This is Mafalda's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use these 10,000 meticals to buy door frames and windows and their respective locks. She's very happy, since soon she will be living in her own home. She's confident that she will pay off the loan early and request another one to pay for preparations for her future wedding.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Раимбердиев  Исроил –мужчина 51  лет, женат и имеет одного сына и дочь.Жена Джумабоева Ойимнисо –домохозяйка,занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Исроил откармливает скот несколько лет. У него в основном дойные коровы,которых доет его жена.Это семейное дело приносит большую пользу и доход семье. Молоко они продают,у себя каждый день есть молочные продукты для детей. У дойной коровы  теленок которого тоже Исроил откармливает несколько месяцев.Таким образом, они зарабатывают себе на жизнь.
texts.en:
Isroil R. is a 51-year-old man, who is married and has one son and a daughter. His wife, Oyimniso Djumaboeva is a homemaker, who is involved in feeding cattle. Isroil has been raising livestock for several years. He primarily has dairy cows that his wife milks. This family business brings a big benefit and income for the family. They sell milk and have dairy products for their children every day. One of the dairy cows has a calf that Isroil has been also raising for several months. This is how he earns his living.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Sokh Ny Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight people living in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Srey Sokh N. is the 30-year-old village bank president. She is a fried-banana seller. She is also a farmer who rents a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and has a lot of insects to damage the crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field.

Mrs. Srey Sokh N.’s husband, Mr. Kung Vutha, works in a restaurant. The couple has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her rice field

loans.name: Santos Luisa

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS LUISA A. A. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Santos está casada y es socia del Banco Comunal Cachanchugo.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de primaria, tiene 5 hijos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Santos se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene instalada en su propia casa.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles compró mas productos para implementar su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1,000  soles, comprará: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, cerveza entre otros; los cuales venderá en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
SANTOS tiene como sueño implementar su tienda con mas productos alimenticios y ampliar su casa para colocar un bar y vender mas cerveza.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Luisa A. A. is 42 years old and lives in the District of Usquil, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Cachanchugo”.

This entrepreneur has a 6th grade education. She has 5 adult children who are financially independent.

Santos sells food from a grocery store she operates out of her home. She used her first loan of 200 soles to buy merchandise to stock her store.

She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, sodas, juices, beer and other products to sell from her grocery store. Santos dreams of offering more products in her store and expanding her house so that she can open a bar to sell more beer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, sodas, juices, beer, etc.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
N. Juliet is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children, with the eldest being 8 years old. She has a retail shop that she has been running for 1 year. She is also a tailor.

From her shop, Juliet makes 150,000/= as profits. She is also looking forward to expanding her tailoring business by opening up a workshop and employing people to help out. She has a dream of seeing all her children educated to the highest level. She needs a loan to help boost her business by buying more products for the shop.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es: La señora Maria Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun todavía dependen de ella. Maria Edith, juntamente con su esposo, decidieron emprender la construcción de ambientes, para el alquiler mensual de dormitorios, a estudiantes, profesionales que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a estudiar o trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 10 dormitorios.Hoy en día, Maria Edith se siente muy contenta con lo logrado, y esta muy conciente que brinda un servicio de calidad, para dejar satisfechos a sus inquilinos.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas dormitorios, al fondo de su casa.Maria Edith, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará materiales de construccion.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen P. is from the town of Clarin. She is 35 years old. Aileen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aileen owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing farming equipment rental services to local community members. Aileen is just starting this business.

In 2008, Aileen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Aileen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gaye Cissé

texts.fr: Gaye Cissé est une femme de 62 ans elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi et y a reçu 3 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissu, savon, huile de palme et ballais fabriqués à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaye Cissé D. is a 62-year-old married woman with five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of "South Mountain" for a year and a half, and has received and reimbursed three previous loans without problem. She has a small business selling fabrics, soaps, palm oil and brooms which she makes from palm fronds. The proceeds of this loan will help her contribute to the financial support of her family.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: generate revenues from sale of fabric, soap, oil & hand-made brooms

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal DIAMANTES está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona de Kupini Central, que están ubicados alrededor de la Cancha de futbol de Kupini, las socias se dedican a la venta de Comida, porcelana, atención de tienda, venta de pasankalla (pipocas), venta de frutas, venta de condimentos,  es una de las bancas que esta conformado por las socias mas antiguas. 
Rosalia,  es la líder y presidenta del banco, es una de las fundadoras del banco, teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 4 ciclos, la socia se dedica a la venta de frutas. En el mercado de kupini. Durante su permanencia, en su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder exigente con sus cuotas de sus compañeras a la hora de pago, respetuosa con sus compañeras con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en su puesto de venta de frutas y poder generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia.
Maria Luisa, la señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una de las que dio origen a la conformación del banco Diamantes se actualmente la socia vende objetos de porcelana en la plaza Eguino (zona central de la ciudad de La Paz), no contaba con capital para su actividad económica, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  mas mercadería y así aumentar su capital y su estabilidad económica.
Jose, Socio que se integra a la banca es su segundo ciclo bastante dinámico, alegre, es la secretario del Banco, actualmente es chofer el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas para arreglar su  movilidad
texts.en:
The Diamantes Community Bank is made up of 10 customers who live in the Kupini Central Zone - located near the Kupini Soccer Field. These partneers work selling food, crockery, clothing, popcorn, fruit, and condiments. It is a bank with the most enduring partners. Rosalia, as leader and president of the bank, is one of the banks founders. The bank has existed for 4 cycles, and Rosalia works selling fruit in the Kupini market. During her term she has learned to be a leader who makes sure that participants make their payments. At the same time she is respectful of her companions, having been able to increase her capital in her fruit stand and bring additional income into her family. Maria Luisa is the treasurer of the bank, and one of founding members of the Diamantes bank. Currently, this partner sells crockery in the Eguino Plaza - located in the downtown area of the city of La Paz. She had not counted on capital for her economic activity, however, with the loan that she will receive she will purchase additional merchandise; increasing her capital and her economic stability. Jose, a partner who has joined the bank is in his second cycle. He is very dynamic, happy. He serves as the secretary of the bank, and is currently working as a driver. He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of tools to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising working capital

loans.name: Reynafabiola

texts.es:
La señor Reyna Fabiola C. Jirón, es una señora de 31 años de edad emprendedor de un negocio de venta Abarrotería .El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$30,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Israel lewite tercer anden contiguo a los perecederos. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; Como es la compra inventario para surtir la abarrotería para competir con la competencia, que se vende mucho en esta época del año por las festividades.

Ella esta casado, con 2 hijos a su cargo, uno  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella trabajaba como domestica.
. 
Lleva 6 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Reyna Fabiola C. Jirón is a 31 year-old woman who has a business selling groceries. She started this business with initial capital of C$30,000.00 that she obtained from a loan 10 years ago. This business is located in the Israel Lewite market on the third sidewalk next to the perishables. The loan that she requests will be invested in her business, buying inventory to stock her store so that she can keep up with her competition. These types of stores have high sales in the current season due to the festivities. She is married, with 2 children in her care, one of whom is school-aged. She says that previous to having this business she was a domestic worker. She has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL over a period of 2 years which have been invested in her business and have made it grow, diversifying her products; all of this is thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy inventory to stock her grocery store with new products

loans.name: Jenniffer Jeanette

texts.es:
La Señora  Jennifer Jeannette Córdoba P., Labora como Jefa de Despacho “B” en el Departamento de Química de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, ella tiene tres hijos a su cargo, los que   se encuentran en edad escolar, es 
madre Soltera, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, Zinc, ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para la edificación de un cuarto habitación, el que le Brindara mejores  condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jennifer Jeannette C. P. works as the Head of “B” office in the Chemistry Department of the National University of Engineering. She is a single mother who takes care of her 3 school-age children.. Jennifer has received loans with CEPRODEL for the last two years and thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL, she has used 3 loans to improve the home where she lives. She is an excellent client. The loan that she is asking for is to buy construction materials such as: iron, zinc, bricks, cement, etc. She will use these to build a bedroom, so that she can offer her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoeun M. lives in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Nget Pheap, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. 

Thus, Mr. Thoeun M. wants to start a new business. He decided to ask for a loan to buy a store at the local market for selling clothes, and he would use the rest of the loan to buy more clothes to re-sell. 

Mr. Thoeun M. is the father of six children, one of whom is a grocer in the local market, while another one is employed in a garment factory. Three others are students in the local school, and the last one is too young to study or work. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a store at the local market for selling clothes and to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Gyan Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Gyan Kuamri M. is a farmer in the village of Thecho. She owns a piece of land where she grows different types of green vegetables. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening. Now she is requesting Rs 15,000 as a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her agricultural work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rodrigo A.

texts.en: Rodrigo A. M. owns and operates a tricycle transport service. He is 57 years old, married and has six grown-up children. He is from Mayor's Village, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rodrigo A. has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Rodrigo A, joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Rodrigo A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 7,900 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is managing a hog-raising business in Bohol.  She is 59 years old, and a mother of four children. She sustains her family with her business.  She wants her business to grow in order to help her family financially and to send her children to school.  

Cirila joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2006.  She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to acquire more pigs and to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and feed

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Dania is the coordinator of her group Cristo La Fuente (Christ the Source), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically based around sugarcane, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Dania is excited to be taking her fourth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her mobile business selling clothing by traveling to the Capital to purchase merchandise such as blouses and blue jeans to sell. 

She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing them school supplies as well as saving towards her goal of one day having a store from which she can sell her clothes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been running a tailoring shop for five years to earn a living. His wife also does tailoring business and, together, they are able to support their family. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has really grown since he can access loans.  He hopes to stabilize his income and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma V. is a married woman who lives in Bool, Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish. Alma’s husband Jaime, is a tricycle driver, and they have 5 children who are between 1 and 11 years old. Three of their children are currently going to school and also help in the business as part of their daily chores.

Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Alma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 40,000 was used to fund the operations of her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 13th cycle loan in the amount of PHP 40,000, which she intends to also use for her fish vending business. Alma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, such as providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa  K. is 19 and single with one child.  She owns a business, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Luisa  has three years of experience in this business.  Luisa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Luisa  joined SPBD, and this is her secnd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Luisa 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Nubia Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Nubia es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos, se dedica al negocio, desde hace varios años tiene una pulpería que ha sido su fuente de entradas. Son muchos años trabajando en ventas y lo difícil que es poder mantener el equilibrio ya que las ventas bajan, y  los productos suben, pero gracias a la inversión de los financiamientos ha logrado mantener su inventario. Cuando inicio  lo hizo joven con su mama ya que también  tenia este negocio. 
Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, así como también gas licuado que se vende mucho ya que es un producto necesario al consumo diario de nuestro hogar. Durante estos periodos no solo a mantenido su negocio con productos también ha mejorado su casa lo cual esta contenta por estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Nubia is a hard-working woman, and she has three children. Her business, which she has had for several years, is a mini-market. It has been her source of income. She has been working in sales for many years. The most difficult part is being able to maintain equilibrium because sales go down and the products rise. But, thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain her inventory. When she started she was a young woman. She started with her mother, who also had this business. With this loan she will buy things like basic grains, beans, rice, sugar, oil, and soap. She will also buy liquefied gas, which sells a lot because it is a necessary product that is used everyday in our homes. During these periods she has not only maintained her business with products, but she has also improved her house. She is happy with these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, oil, soap, and liquefied gas

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinignèssigui  est constitué de cinq femmes de la ville de Tominian (quatrième Région  administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et une moyenne de 4 enfants par femme. 
Elles mènent différentes activités commerciales: vente de produits divers, de condiments alimentaires, de fruits et de céréales. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 1er cycle  de prêt solidaire. 
Les femmes du groupe Sinignèssigui  achètent leurs marchandises à San et Bamako (capitale du Mali) et vendent au marché de Tominian et dans les foires de Mandiaky et environnants.  
Parmi les membres du groupe se trouve une femme du nom de Mama M. qui est sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité de ses condiments alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en gros  pour effectuer ses ventes à Tominian en demi gros, au comptant et en détail à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25 cartons de maggi de toutes sortes, 50 petits sacs de sel, 120kg de l’ail, 70kg de poivre et 15kg de laurier. 
Madame Mama M. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 19000FCFA qui servira à rembourser le prêt,  agrandir les activités et venir en aide aux conjoints pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Sinignèssigui group is made up of five women from the town of Tominian (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through relatives and neighbors. They are all married and average 35 years of age, with an average of four children per woman. They carry out different commercial activities: the sale of various products, condiments, fruits and cereals. In order to grow their activities, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, and they are on their first group loan with the institution. The women in the Sinignèssigui group buy their goods in San and Bamako (the capital of Mali), and they sell at the market in Tominian and at the fairs in Mandiaky and the surrounding areas. Among the members of the group there is a lady called Mama M., who is in demand from her customers for the quality of her condiments. She gets her supplies wholesale in Bamako and sells them in Tominian on a partly wholesale basis, for cash and on a retail basis to a customer base which is essentially made up of women. She is planning to use her loan to buy 25 cartons of all different types of Maggi stock cubes, 50 bags of salt, 120 kg of garlic, 70kg of pepper and 15kg of bay leaves. Mrs. Mama M. expects to make a monthly profit of 19,000FCFA, which will be used to repay her loan, expand her business and help her husband out with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso es un hombre que desde joven se dedico al trabajo con sus padres, actualmente está casado y trabaja como proveedor de frutas y verduras en la zona, cuenta también con su local de venta donde atiende su Señora.
El opto por el crédito con la Fundación para adquirir más gas como cebollas, lechugas, naranjas, manzanas,  mandarinas, con el fin de ir aumentando el margen de su negocio.
El cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Since he was a young man, Celso has worked with his parents. Today, he is married and works as a regional fruit and vegetable producer. He also relies on his store for income, which his wife manages. He seeks a loan through the Fundación so that he may acquire a greater variety of produce, such as onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, and mandarins, which would increase the profit margin of his business. Señor Celso expresses his satisfaction at working with the Fundación, and for the support they have provided in helping him to develop and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de frutas y verduras (manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas, cebollas, lechugas, tomates, pimientos )

loans.name: Rocel Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Marilu es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia y los otros dos son menores de edad, vive en casa de su mama, Marilu tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días, su negocio tiene 5 años.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Marilu son comprar una casa propia y su hijo estudie en el colegio militar.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Glorious Community Bank. She is single with three children. One child goes to school and the others are younger and stay at home with their mother. Marilu has a store in her house. She sells general grocery items such as meat and vegetables. This is an activity that she has done everyday for the past five years. Marilu needs a loan of 1250 soles. She will use this money to buy drinks, rice and sugar. Marilu dreams of buying her own house. She hopes her child will study in military school.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of drinks, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. M. is 24 years old, married and has two children: ages five years old and two months. Her business is located at Pipeline in Kisumu. She has been selling motor vehicle spare parts. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge she has had is relocating several time and losing contact with her customers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Esther is using her loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motor spare parts to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and become a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as self-motivated, result-oriented and persuasive.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona L. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Jhona is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Jhona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jhona has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jhona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jhona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jhona is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jhona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: R. S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Unity. R. is 40 years old and married with nine children who range from 6 months to 19 years old. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of support. For 5 years, he has sold coconuts in West Point Market, down-town Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 4,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 24,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more coconuts. He describes himself as an earnest and hard-working man whose dream is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts.

loans.name: Paola Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Paola B. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia Turi la misma que se caracteriza por ser el balcón de la ciudad de Cuenca, de donde se admira gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica  a la cría de animales y a la agricultura la misma que en la mayor parte es solo para el consumo.

La Señorita Paola tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres la misma que es propia, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y su papá es chofer profesional.
 
Paola se dedica a atender el bar de un colegio en el cual labora medio día y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a estudiar en la universidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por su tía a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que luchan con el fin de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. El  crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra productos para el bar.
 
Su meta es ser una profesional en el campo de la medicina.
texts.en:
Paola B. is a member of the community bank named "El Mirador". She lives in the region of Turi and it is known as Cuenca's lookout, as it is here from where you can see the expanse of the city. The population is made up of farmers and agriculturists, products that are mostly consumed within the city. Paola is 21 years old, she is single, and she lives with her parents' house. Her mother takes care of the household chores and her father works in public transportation. Paola is a cafeteria worker in the local school. She works half days and the rest of the time she takes courses in university. This is her first loan with the community bank where she was invited by her aunt to take part of the group. These women all struggle to find greater financial stability for their homes. The loan granted through Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) will be invested in products to be sold in her cafeteria. Her goal is to be a health care professional.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juices, snacks, sweets etc.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sunita G.. She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 7. In 2005, she established her grocery business. She supports her family working 7 hours a day, 7 days a week. She wants to use this loan from Patan BPW to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Sunita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microc-redit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: De

texts.en:
Mr. De R. (shown in the photo) is 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kea Leng, is 41 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

De is a farmer and assists his wife in the business when he is free. Mrs. Kea Leng sells Pha Ork in Koki market. Pha Ork is made with chopped fish, salt, sugar, yeast and rice, placed in large airtight jars and allowed to ferment. 

De is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for his wife to purchase fish to produce Pha Ork to sell.

loans.use: To help finance his wife to purchase fish to produce Pha Ork for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for five years. His mixed farm produces maize, which he sells locally, and tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and price fluctuations.

Joseph is 41 years old. He and his wife have been blessed with six children: the youngest is still a baby and the eldest is 15 years old. The four older children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and that the dairy cow will be a source of milk to the family as well. 

In future, he would like to buy land that will enable him expand his dairy farming endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Atakola Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: Jamila W. is 40years old and a member of the Atakola women’s Group.  She has been running a restaurant business for the last 10 years. It is a business that has been generating 100,000 shillings per week as profits. Jamila is a married woman, with 6 kids. She says to begin in this business, she got financial assistance from her husband. Previously, she was a house wife. With this loan, she says she is going to buy materials such as cement, sand and iron sheets for building a family house and also to buy foods like maize flour, bananas and beans for her restaurant.

loans.use: The purchase of materials such as cement, sand, etc for building the family house

loans.name: Sderng

texts.en: Sderng Y., 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. Y. produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Her husband is a driver for tourists, earning an income of about 10 USD per day. Y. has to spend 25 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to replace her husband’s old car. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a new car for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, onion, tomato etc. for sale at market

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 32 years old. Jessie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie plants and harvests corn to sell. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP every harvesting season (every four months).

In 2009, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be Jessie's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Protais

texts.en:
Protais is 55 years old and married to a farmer. They have eight children who are between 15 and 25 years old. All his children go to school. 

Protais owns a business selling a large variety of goods. With this loan, he will add more merchandise such as sugar, sodas, rice, potatoes, eggs and tea to sell. He hopes to use the profit from this business to pay school fees for his children, make savings and build a house. Protais' plan is to work hard and in the future become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more items to resell

loans.name: Abigaël Group

texts.fr: Kamwanya M.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Abigaël, âgée de 55 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants.  Son conjoint est un policier, officier de l’ordre public. Kamwanya M.  est vendeuse de Chikwange (aliment approprié et original aux congolais-Kinshasa)  à son domicile.  Elle fait également le commerce de divers pour accroitre ses revenus. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Depuis 1998, elle exerce cette activité traditionnelle. Vers 2007, elle diversifia son activité avec le commerce de divers.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  des nouveaux produits (manioc, eau, sachets emballage, braise, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne voir ses enfants qui sont à l’université finir leurs études. La cliente Kamwanya M.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Abigaël est constitué de 37 membres.
texts.en:
Kamwanya M. is an entrepreneure, and president of the Abigaël solidarity group, which is composed of 37 members. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a police officer. Kamwanya M. sells Chikwange (a typical Kinshasa-Congolese bread dish) from her home. She also sells various other items to increase her income. 

She started her business with her own funds received from her husband, and has been engaged in this traditional activity since 1998. In 2007, she diversified her business by selling a variety of goods. Later, in early 2010, she obtained a $50 loan from the Hekima MFI. 

Kamwanya M. will use the new loan to stock up on merchandise (cassava, water, packaging bags, charcoal, etc.). She also plans to help her children finish their university studies. 

Kamwanya M. wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping the less fortunate who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy cassava, water, packaging bags, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
La vivienda del señor Gerardo R. se vio afectada al suceder un accidente automovilístico ahí ya que el automóvil tiro su cerca por lo que el señor está solicitando de nuestra ayuda  para así poder contratar a alguien que repare la cerca,porque desea brindarle una mayor seguridad a su familia.
El planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que gana de tramitador.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo R.’s dwelling was affected by an automobile accident in that the car knocked down his fence.  He is asking for our help to hire someone to repair the fence because he wants to provide better security for his family.

He plans to repay the loan with income he earns as an Expeditor

loans.use: For interior finishing touches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Mayeser

texts.en:
Mayeser H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 25 years old and married with three children. Two of them go to school. 

H. borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en:
Mehriban A. is 47, an enterprising woman, always happy to do good work. When she was young, she had the goal of self-improvement. 

For about seven years she has been breeding cattle. Her elder son actively helps her to graze cows. This allows her to support her three children who are her reason for being. She has raised them alone since she is a widow. Mehriban's parents also live with them. 

Mehriban wants to increase her capital to buy new animals so she can keep supporting the family. She needs a loan to purchase two baby cows.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sistes-in-laws). Harriet has a business of drug shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of drugs. 

She also generates additional income through farming.The main business challenges for Harriet include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of drugs and pharmaceutical syrups

loans.name: Jairo De Jesús

texts.es:
Jairo A. Trabaja vendiendo en la calle productos de legumbrería desde hace 30 años, sin embargo hace 10 años, espacio público le otorgó un puesto fijo donde vender más cómodamente sus productos. Jairo trabaja de 6:00a.m. a 7:00p.m. 

Es un hombre muy emprendedor, padre de 3 hijos quien ha sacado a su familia adelante gracias a su negocio, a pesar de que el invierno no sólo le disminuye las ventas si no que también los productos no tienen la misma calidad. 

Jairo actualmente necesita surtir  su negocio, comprar legumbres suficientes para mejorar sus ingresos, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente. 

Su mayor sueño es tener algún día su propia tienda donde pueda vender no sólo productos de legumbrería si no también de confitería y cigarrería en general.
texts.en:
Jairo A. has been selling vegetables on the street for 30 years. 10 years ago, he was granted a fixed public space to sell his products more comfortably. Jairo works from 6:00am to 7:00pm.

He is a very enterprising man and father of 3 children, who has gotten his family ahead thanks to his business and in spite of the winter not only decreasing his sales but also diminishing the quality of his products. Jairo needs to stock up his business by buying enough goods to increase his income, but he doesn't have sufficient capital. 

His greatest dream is to someday have his own store to sell not only vegetables but also sweets and tobacco products.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to increase his inventory

loans.name: Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia is 50 years old and married with three children between the ages 7 and 23 years old. She works in her general store from 8am until 8pm every day and has five year's of experience. Egidia sells water, juice, breads, cooking oil, rice and so on.

Egidia has requested a loan from Kiva lender to purchase more beans, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil and so on. With the profits, Egidia will pay school fees for her children and save money.

loans.use: To purchase beans, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil, rice and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 3 years, Zubeda has been operating a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells Kikoi's to contribute another source of income to her livelihood.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Zebeda wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Victoria; tiene 44 años D. edad y La socia es separada y tiene 3 hijos y la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia alterna sus actividades con la venta D. caramelos en la carreta y ella también tiene un stand D. compra y venta D. libros, la socia trabaja en este negocio desD. hace 3 años, la socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el crédito en la adquisición D. un grupo D. libros para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. libros para la venta.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta D. libros, un socio hace pre ventas en telefónica, otros dos socios tienen una flota D. taxis y los otros socios son empleados D. la empresa y hacen la labor D. operadores y recepcionistas, venta D. caramelos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Amigos Emprendedores".  She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.  

Victoria is 44 years old and separated.  She has 3 children and works in retail.  She alternates her daily activities with her cart candy sales.  She has a stand also where she sells books.  She has been running this business for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase books to sell.  

The other members sell books, candy,  one works in telemarketing, two others have a fleet of taxis and the other members are employees who work as drivers and receptionists.  

Victoria values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted since this will allow her grow with her business and improve her quality of life.  She is also committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase books to sell.

loans.name: Euis

texts.en:
Euis is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She has had a business of electronic goods and clothes since 2005, and from its income she could pay for school for her children and even courses outside school hours.

Euis has used her current loan of 4,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to open a new business that sells drinks like coke and snacks like chiki, as well as renting playstations.

Last month from her savings, she could afford for her daughter to marry, and now she wants to invest to be able to have a shop for each of her children to finance their own lives.

loans.use: to pay for drinks like pop, ice and snacks

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamella is 54 years old. She has been living in a settlement for internally displaced people since 1996. She and her husband purchase and resell sheep as their business. She has four children. Tamella would like to request a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats in order to purchase additional sheep. This will increase her inventory and meet her customers' demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Tamella would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further.

loans.use: to purchase 8 lambs and fodder.

loans.name: Endira

texts.es: Endira tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada  en la comunidad de Otari del distrito de Pichari. Endira es una mujer joven y emprendedora, se dedica a comercializar frutas que sus padres cultivan y cosechan, es así que como se gana la vida y puede generarse su propio capital. Ella lleva dicha mercadería a la provincia de huamanga que es donde tiene sus potenciales clientes. Ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a este negocio, el único inconveniente que tiene es que no cuenta con movilidad, por ello desea adquirir un furgón, de esta manera pueda transportar sus frutas en mejor condición. Endira esta a gusto con el negocio que tiene, por que si le genera buenos ingresos económicos y de esta manera solventa los gastos de la universidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo utilizará para incrementar la producción de frutas y aumentar así sus ganancias, por tanto comprar abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en: Endira is 24 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' house located in the community of Otari in the Pichari district. Endira is a young, entrepreneurial woman dedicated to selling fruit that her parents grow and harvest. It is this way that she makes a living and is able to generate her own money. She takes this merchandise to the Huamanga province where her potential customers are. She has already been dedicated to this business for six years. The only inconvenience that she has is that she doesn't have mobility. As a result, she wishes to acquire a wagon with which she can transport her fruit in better condition. Endira is comfortable with the business that she has because it generates good income and, in this way, she pays the college bills. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual in her repayments. With the 3,000 new "soles" she will increase production of fruit and increase her earnings so she will buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
Blanca Lucila tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres e hijo de 20 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Blanca se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de su producto. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta jugar escuchar música y realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en:
Blanca Lucila is 47 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and 20 year-old son in the Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.  The "La Nueve de Abril" (9th of April) village bank is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, in the Chillanes canton. The members of this group are farmers, and grow mainly corn and cacao.  

Blanca grows corn and cacao.  She buys and sells her products in the market of San José del Tambo.  She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, and agricultural inputs.  The loan will help her meet her financial needs, and improve the quality of her product.  The challenges she faces are drops in prices of the products she sells and the middlemen. Her dream is to have her own house. She enjoys listening to music and doing housework.

loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 32 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos. Juntos habitan en casa de su padre. El trabajo de Lily consiste en la venta de comida por las noches en un pequeño espacio de su casa. Recién lleva poco meses en este trabajo y cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que siempre trabajó en este negocio, asimismo vende ropa y algunos accesorios, también posee tres mototaxis, que los alquila, logrando obtener ingresos fijos. En adelante quisiera intalar un negocio de comida en su casa, pues se ubica en el Km. 6 de la carretera y eso le daría mucha ventaja. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, considera que su grupo es muy bueno y muy responsables, espera poder seguir trabajando junto a la institución ya que le encanta que confíen en ella y que le den la oportunidad de creer como negociante. Con el monto solicitado, comprará un mototaxi más, ya que su meta es poner una flota de transporte para que pueda generar más ganancia.
texts.en:
Lily is thirty-two-years-old.  She is a happy and very hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner, with whom she has two children.  They all live together in her father's house.  Lily's sells food during the evenings from a small space in her house, which she's been doing for just a few months, with help from her her sister.  She really likes what she does because she has always done this kind of work. She also sells clothing and accessories, and she has three motorcycle taxis that she rents out, giving her fixed income. 

In the future, Lily would like to have a restaurant in her house, because she lives at Km 6 on the freeway and the location would give her a big advantage.  This will be her third loan cycle with MFP.  She thinks her group is really good and very responsible.  She hopes to keep working with MFP because she loves how they trust her and give her the chance to believe in herself as a businesswoman.  With loan she's seeking, she'll buy another motorcycle taxi because it's her goal to have a fleet so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 41 years old, married to Solomon, and they are blessed with two children who are over 18 years of age.  She has been in the hardware business for the last two years, making a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.  She has been loaned 60,000 KES and this is her second loan. She plans to purchase tiles, sinks, etc. for sale.

With the anticipated profit she plans to expand her business and also invest in other profitable businesses. In the near future she hopes to be a great supplier of building materials in the area.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, sinks, etc. for sale

loans.name: Helfy

texts.en:
Helfy is a 38-year-old entrepreneur who is married to Benyamin, a 41-year-old man. From their marriage they are blessed with two children; they are Reinold, 17 years old, and Wiwin, 15 years old; both are at school. 

Helfy owns a food stall business; it is located about 2 km from her house. She cooks the special menu from pork, such as sate (small pieces of meat roasted on skewer), smoked beef, kidney bean soup, etc. She operates this business from 9 am to 9 pm. Her daughter usually helps her in running this business.  Even though the price of pork in the market is unstable, Helfy is always keen to run her business.   

Helfy is dreaming to improve her business but she does not have enough capital to do so. She heard about TLM and got interested in joining TLM Individual Lending Program; she then applied for this loan and requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. Helfy would like to spend the loan on pork and cooking spices. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: To purchase pork and cooking spices.

loans.name: 0302011-Tây Hải -Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lợi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle that she plans to raise in order to sell in the future.

Lợi is 59 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 0302011 Tây Hải Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. In 2007, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lợi has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lợi hopes that her business will do well and make enough money. With the profit from her business, she hopes to remodel her house and provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nieves Yaqueline

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nieves; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución estatal y ahora requiere el crédito para invertir en la fiesta de promoción de su menor hija, la socia desea el crédito para pagar la compra del vestido de promoción, el pago de la cuota que le pide el colegio para pagar el local, los bocaditos, la decoración y otros detalles para la realización de la fiesta de promoción de su menor hija. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fiesta de promoción de nivel primario de su menor hija.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Nieves belongs to the 'Atipay' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Nieves is 34 years old, married, and has two children who are 11 and 6 years old.  She works in a state institution and needs this loan to invest in her  daughter's graduation party.  She would like this loan to buy a graduation dress and to cover the sum that the school is requesting to pay for the venue,  snacks, decorations and other touches required for her daughter's graduation party.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her daughter's (elementary school) graduation party.  

Nieves is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in her daughter's (elementary school) graduation party

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Kenyan man aged 26 years old. He operates a barber shop in an area known as Maasai Lodge in the region of Ongata Rongai. The area is densely populated and his customers are mostly the local residents in the area. He has been running this business for five years and has hired two employees. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has are high costs of operation, especially electricity bills. He will use his loan of KES 50,000 to buy electric shavers. Besides the barber shop, Paul also farms. In the future, he wishes to have a modern barber shop that is fully stocked with proper equipment. He is described as very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy electric shavers.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Concepción del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la producción y venta de postres  Nicaragüenses como atol, arroz de leche, pio quintó y cajetas, sopa de borracha…etc. Este negocio lo inicio hace 32 años con el cual ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Concepción del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who produces and sells Nicaraguan desserts such as “atol” (corn porridge), rice pudding, rum cakes with caramel sauce, drunken sponge cake, and other items.  She started this business 32 years ago so that she could help her three children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy milk, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva es una señora de 55 años de edad quien vive con su hija en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
Minerva se dedica a la costura. Ella brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente Minerva está solicitando un microcrédito de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de una máquina de coser, ya que quiere solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar.
Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Minerva es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Minerva, 55, lives with her daughter in Trinchera del Pital, a small town in Alajuela province.  Farming and livestock-rearing are the base for the local economy.  Pineapples, most of which are grown for export, are especially important here and have contributed to the town's prosperity.  Economic growth has generated an increase in demand for products and services, along with new jobs.
