Đinh Thị L. is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Nguyễn Thị (20213030032) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH.. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trần Thị T. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Tô Thị H. (0) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Đinh Thị L. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất L. & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for ten years and has employed one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces tea, which she sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, as well as maize, sorghum and bananas which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Josephine is 34 years old. She is married with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for her children and improving the living standards of her family. She faces the challenge of diseases, which affects her crops and animals. In five years time, she plans to increase the number of her dairy cows to four and start a wholesale business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia  es una cliente antigua de la institución , puntual y responsable la señora se dedica  a la venta de ropa usada la cual la compra en fardos y los vende en la feria 16 de julio (en el alto), la señora también se dedica a la venta de laminas escolares las cuales las distribuye en las librerías de distintas zonas de la ciudad de La Paz, ella tiene dos hijitos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar con los cuales sube a la feria a vender los sacos y ternos, el crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad y la compra de fardos de ropa para las fiestas de fin de año. Es una clienta bastante trabajadora,  y alegre, el dinero del crédito es para el arreglo de su movilidad ya que esta en mal estado y no  le permite llevar sus fardos de ropa a la venta, también es para compra de fardos de ropa.
texts.en: Cinthia is an old client of our institution.  She is punctual and responsible.  She works selling used clothes which she buys in bundles and sells in the '16 de Julio' market in El Alto.  She also sells educational laminated posters which she distributes to bookstores in different areas of the city of La Paz.  She has two small school-age children who she takes to the market with her to sell jackets and suits.  The loan which she is requesting is to provide maintenance for her vehicle and to buy bundles of clothes for the end-of-year festivities.  She is a hard-working and happy client of our institution.

loans.use: To invest in repairs to her vehicle and to purchase bundles of clothes

loans.name: Ma. Zosima

texts.en: Ma. Zosima C. is a married woman who lives in Zone 5, Barangay Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general store and a fish vending business. Her husband Renaldo C., who is 55 years old, works as a tailor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 20 and 30 years old. Ma. Zosima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $188, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock that she can sell to customers so that she can continue to save up for future improvements in her business. Ma. Zosima C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of gasoline and mobile phone chargers

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian B. is from the village of Lemu Sur. She is 27 years old. Lilian is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lilian B..

Lilian is single. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a business catching and selling fresh-water fish at the market. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilian from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ong'angi

texts.en:
Ong'angi is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya where he has been farming for eighteen years. He sells his maize, beans, vegetables and tea to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. Ong'angi is also a primary school teacher.

Ong'angi is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. Ong'angi’s biggest business challenges have been diseases, poor weather conditions, and poor infrastructure. In future, Ong'angi plans to acquire a vehicle to help him transport his products to the market. He also plans to open a big retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood selling business for the last three years, selling at the market and at retail to her neighbors and food vendors. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to operate at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her family living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: María Silvania

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal El Amanecer.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, el último de sus hijos que es soltero  y vive con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que  trabaja a base de  pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite, lo que más vende  es la ropa de mujer y nos cuenta que lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Su sueño es algún dia tener un local en su casa para vender sin tener que salir de su casa.
texts.en:
In the Nueva Esperanza district of the city of Manta, there are beautiful beaches that are visited year round. It is here that the Communal Bank “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) meets every fifteen days.

Sra. María is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the support given to her and the convenience by which she received the loans. María is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and has six children who are already adults. Her youngest child is single and lives with her.

María sells clothing and conducts her sales by going door-to-door. In addition, customers come to her home. Her sales are made according to orders she receives from her customers. She works four days per week, offers her products on credit, and collects payments every fifteen days. María acquires her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen days or on a monthly basis according to what she needs. What she sells most is women’s clothing. María has been in this business for four years and has done very well.

The loan will be used to buy more clothing such as women’s garments, trousers, blouses, underwear, and other items. Her dream is to someday have a store in her house where she can sell without leaving home.

loans.use: Purchase women’s garments, trousers, blouses, underwear, and other items

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu I. is a widow supporting six children. She is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast, where she sells food items and runs a provision store. 
To provide her children with a good education, she needs to increase her earnings to save up for their school fees. She intends to do this by increasing her revenue. A loan will allow her to purchase more items to attract more customers and improve sales.

loans.use: To purchase more items to attract more customers and improve sales.

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es:
Carlos Gonzalo B. F. es un joven de 23 años que vive con su Madre en la zona Oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba.  En el Barrio conocido como Capacachi. Carlos es Bachiller y actualmente estudia para tripulante de vuelo. Carlos es soltero. Como manera de poder pagarse los cursos para tripulante de vuelo Carlos se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de Computadora esta actividad la inicio como hobby y ahora son más de 3 años que realiza la misma.

Carlos necesita el crédito Capital de Operación para Comercio y de esta manera poder comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos ya que la Demanda para los mismos está muy elevada porque es mucha más común ahora que una gran mayoría tenga computadora. Carlos desea poder finalizar su carrera como tripulante de Vuelo que es su mayor sueño y luego ganar lo suficiente para poder mantener tanto a su persona como a su Mama.
texts.en:
Carlos Gonzalo B. F. is 23 years old, and lives with his mother in the western area of the city of Cochabamba in the neighborhood known as Capacachi.  Carlos has a bachelor's degree and is currently studying to be a flight crew member.    He is single.  In order to pay for his flight crew courses, Carlos buys and sells spare computer parts.  He began doing this as a hobby and has been doing it for three years.

Carlos is asking for this loan to use as operating capital for his business so that he can purchase a larger quantity of computer parts.  The demand for parts is very high because it more common for a majority of people to own a computer. 

Carlos wants to finish his studies to become a flight crew member because it is his dream and he would be able to earn enough money to support himself and his mother.

loans.use: Purchase computer parts

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo wants a loan to buy groundnuts and coffee for resale. He is a married man dealing in produce in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children. He also desires to expand his business into neighbouring areas.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and coffee

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old. She is a widow with children, and she comes from Kisumu City. 

Rosemary has a retail shop that she has been running for the past seven years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use the money to add stock to her shop, including cooking oil, bread, one sack of sugar and one sack of rice. Rosemary earns a profit of KES 12,000, and that money helps her to provide for her children's needs and ensures that they are in school by paying their school fees on time.

Rosemary hopes to have a wholesale business in the future instead of retail. She also desires to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, bread, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia cuenta con un negocio denominado “Miscelánea Jaqueline” que cuenta con mas de 10 años en operación para el publico. Donde ofrece variedad de producto como lo es refrescos, botanas, comida enlatada, frijol, harina y mas para la necesidad de cada cliente. 
Este negocio ha permanecido con esa antigüedad por el trato hacia sus clientes, lo cual le permite a la señora seguir sosteniendo los gastos del hogar, para seguir ofreciendo calidad y un mejor servicio necesita capital para comprar producto para tener mayor surtido su local.
texts.en:
Alicia has a business called “Miscelánea Jaqueline,” that has been in operation for 10 years.  Here she sells soft drinks, snacks, canned food, beans, flour, and other items that her customers need.

She’s managed to keep her business going for so long because of the service she gives her clients.  The income helps her pay the household expenses.  She needs to increase her working capital in order to buy more items so that she can have a wider assortment in her store.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Santo Tomas se encuentra localizado en Popotlan, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, esta conformado por Anita va a comprar cacerolas y recaudos para surtir su negocio, Eloisa va a comprar ropa interior por mayoreo, Leticia va a comprar zapatos y catálogos para surtir su negocio, Enrique va a comprar maíz para sembrar, Marcelina va a comprar refrescos, aceite, azúcar, huevo, jabón, cloro, papel higiénico, veladoras etc. para su tienda de abarrotes. La señora Anita es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 56 años de edad vive en unión libre, tiene 7 hijos Susana de 36 años de edad, Surey tiene 33 años de edad, Omar de 28 años de edad, José Francisco y José Augusto de 24 años de edad, Patricia de 23 años de edad y Luis Ángel de 15  años de edad, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar utensilios para preparar la comida como son vaporeras, cacerolas, cuchara cafetera y vasos chicos para yogurt ya que en la Telesecundaria donde vende los alimentos a los alumnos y maestros le prohibieron utilizar productos desechables, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella aprendió en su trabajo estuvo mucho tiempo trabajando en restaurante, ella ofrece a sus clientes picaditas, tlacoyos, tacos de arroz, taquitos de suadero, flautas, dobladas de pollo, enchiladas, tostadas, pozole, tacos dorados, les va cambiando el menú, su negocio es importante porque le gusta cocinar, apoyar a los niños de la Telesecundaria y tiene su fuente de trabajo. Ella está muy contenta con este préstamo porque va a comprar sus utensilios para la cocina para preparar sus alimentos con mejor calidad y se vea bonita su cocina. Sus sueños y esperanzas son crecer en su negocio, tener buena salud y fuerzas para trabajar también que sus hijos tengan un buen trabajo y su hijo el chico tenga una profesión. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su confianza que nos dan, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante, para que nuestros negocios crezcan y tengan fuerza”.

loans.use: to buy steamers, pans, spoons, and small glasses for yogurt

loans.name: Sétou

texts.fr:
Madame Sétou est âgée de 64  ans, veuve  et  mère  de 8 enfants. Elle  vit avec ses enfants et petits enfants  au  quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Infirmière de formation et de profession, après sa retraite, elle continue les activités en enseignant aujourd’hui dans une école de formation d’infirmier, et en faisant le petit commerce. Elle le mène depuis 12 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété, sa force de vente est due au ciblage de sa clientèle qui est composée majoritairement d’étudiants et personnels médicaux.  
Dans le souci de toujours satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle sollicite ce nouveau  prêt. Elle  est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso,  depuis 54 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3  prêts  individuels  tous correctement remboursés, elle    est à son 4ème prêt individuel. Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 70 complets de lit draps. Elle   s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
 Avec ce prêt elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA,   qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt,  de continuer son activité et de satisfaire certaine de ses charges.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sétou is 64 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight. She lives with her children and grandchildren in the Sébougou district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).A nurse by training and profession, after her retirement, she continues to teach in a nursing school, and also works as a vendor. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has a lot of experience and is well-known. Her strength is in being able to reach out to her target customers, mostly students and medical personnel.

With the goal of continuing to meet the growing customer demand, she is seeking this new loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 54 months; after three solidarity loans and three individual loans, all duly repaid, she is now on her 4th individual loan. She plans to use it to buy 70 sets of bed linens. She stock ups in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to repay her loan, maintain her business and cover some of her expenses.

loans.use: to buy bed linens

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Ugandan male aged 41 years who needs a loan to pay labourers to weed his banana plantation.  He hails from Kyenjojo district and is a father of nine children aged between 16 and 2 years.  He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income generating activities to supplement his earnings. A farmer of 20 years, he acquired his start up capital from accumulated savings from his government job.

loans.use: pay labourers to weed his banana plantation

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en una comunidad urbana en vías de desarrollo perteneciente  a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Carlos es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso en su labor.

La actividad que desarrolla es el servicio de enllante y desenllante al público en general dentro de su vivienda. Esta actividad, que no le permite tener muchas comodidades pero sí subsistir, la viene desarrollando desde hace 7 años y cuenta con clientes fijos, quienes están satisfechos con el servicio que Carlos brinda.

Carlos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para hacer mejoras dentro de su vivienda, pues esta la necesita, esto le permitirá a Carlos y a sus padres mejorar la calidad de vida que hasta ahora tienen.

Carlos es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad y ha cancelado todos sus pagos adecuadamente. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old and lives in his parents' home in a developing, urban community, in Chiclayo province.  He is a hard-working man who is committed to his work.

Carlos provides a tire change service to the general public from his home.  This business does not allow him to enjoy many comforts in life but it does allow him to survive.  He has been in the business for seven years and he has regular customers who are satisfied with the service that he provides.

Carlos is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to make some necessary improvements to the inside of his home.  This will allow Carlos and his parents to improve their quality of life.

Carlos is an existing client of our institution who has made all his previous loan repayments properly.  He would be very grateful to receive this loan as it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to improve the inside of his home

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 39 years old, is married to an overseas Filipino worker and is blessed with 1 child. He has been growing rice for almost 10 years. His net income last cropping was 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. He would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva and ASKI to request larger loans so that he can grow his business and earn more income to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
Nozim is 43 years old. He’s married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper who looks after their children. Nozim is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. He has a cafe where he sells national meals and foodstuffs. He has been in the business for almost 19 years. Nozim is trying to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his café and to ensure his clients have the option to eat, to have a rest and make the necessary purchases. His business is stable and that allows him to generate significant income and to ensure worthy living for his family. Now, Nozim’s children are growing and the expenses for them are rising too. Thus, Nozim wants to increase his business to earn more money to be able to cover the expenses of his children. With this purpose, he requests $3000 USD to expand his café. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand his cafe

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Gricelda  de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en   el distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Gricelda se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su hogar.  Gricelda es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para los suyos.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 29, lives with her husband and son in her own house which does not yet have basic utilities and is located in Mochumí District which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  This area is noted for farming, livestock raising and tourism.

For a few years approximately, Gricelda has been selling groceries (products that are used daily like: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages.  Her business is located in her home for her comfort and security.  Profits from sales are used to try to cover her expenses and to improve her quality of life.

To be able to expand her business, she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise her only wish being that the business grows and to have more products available to offer her customers to be able to repay the loan and meet her household expenses.  Gricelda is a responsible, dedicated, hard working person who strives to have more comforts for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
María Luzmila tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres  e hijo de 12 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

María se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios.

Le gusta realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en:
María Luzmila, 32, is single.  She lives with her parents and her 12-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  Its members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

María is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

She requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet her economic needs and to improve the quality of her farming activities.  She faces challenges like the drop in price of products she sells as well as middlemen.  Her dream is that her son finishes his schooling.  She enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijas, pero solo vive con dos de ellas. El trabajo que realiza es la venta de zapatos, ropa y lencería, productos que ofrece a sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Lleva con este trabajo alrededor de 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora, además que lo hace en compañía de su esposo, además de tener tiempo para poder hacer otras cosas más. Por el momento ella solo piensa mantener su negocio, por ello desea abastecerse de más mercadería para ofrecer variedad de clientes. Este es el crédito número 15 con MFP, y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para crecer su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos para su venta como ropa, zapato, lencería y otros objetos.
texts.en: Sonia is 49 years old and is a very dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives with her common-law husband and 2 of the 3 daughters she had with  him. She works selling shoes, clothes and lingerie to her friends, neighbours and relatives. She has been in this business for about 22 years and up until now she is doing well. In addition, she gets to work with her husband and it gives her free time to do other things. For now, she is thinking of only maintaining the business. She therefore wants to stock up on more merchandise to offer a variety of products to her clients. This is her 15th loan with MFP and therefore hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you to grow her business. With the amount requested, she will buy more products to sell such as clothes, shoes, lingerie and other products.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, shoes and lingerie

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 41 years old and is a married man with 2 children, aged 12 and 3.  He works as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Norberto plants rice and corn crops on his land and sells his harvest to traders. He earns about 8000 PHP per month doing this farming business.

Norberto has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent. He hopes to improve his family’s living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent

loans.name: Toleujan

texts.en:
Toleujan is 34 years old and lives with his children and wife in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His children are high school students. He started his business in 1995 by transporting goods and products. Now he transports coal from the Hotgor coal mine. With his business profits, he purchased a small car his family. During the summer time, when coal transportation is slow, he becomes a taxi driver. 

He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to build a prosperous life for my children and family." He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase spare parts for his truck and increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a banker by profession and his major goal is to complete his professional course. Alex needs the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: To pay his own school fees.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 21 y 27 años, ella se dedica a vender tamales de (pollo y de frijoles) todos los días en su colonia, ya que sus clientes la esperan, de lunes a domingo. 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima (hoja de huerta, maíz, pollo,condimentos, leña) de esa forma regenerara más ganancias y mantendrá siempre el negocio.
El sueño de María es tener un negocio más rentable y darles lo mejor a sus hijos ya que de ella dependen y que sigan estudiando para que se superen.
texts.en: María is a single mother of two, ages 21 and 27. She sells chicken and bean tamales in her neighborhood every day, since her customers await her Sunday through Saturday. She needs the loan in order to purchase basic supplies (leaves for wrapping, corn, chicken, seasonings, and firewood). In this way she will recoup more profits and keep her business going. María's dream is to have a more profitable business and give her children the best, since they depend on her and are continuing their studies so they can better themselves.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, corn, seasonings, and firewood, for preparing tamales

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 3,100,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Kai is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Manjamadu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Kai is 45 years old and he is married with 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Kai has been a professional teacher for 7 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to buy household furniture and house building materials for the rehabilitation of his house.

loans.use: to buy household furniture and house building materials for the rehabilitation of his house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children.

Ali is a professional tailor. Since 2000, he has owned a workshop where he makes, repairs, and alters clothing such as as suits, coats, and trousers for women and men. He has more than four years' experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He has decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Isabel Virgen

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Virgen es casada, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 7 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía, tejido  de cortes típicos, de diferentes diseños y colores, inicio este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizar para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores, y tener mas producción de cortes, espera en el futuro contar con operarios.
texts.en: Isabel Viren is 38 years old and is married. She completed four years of primary education and has seven children who are in school. She works making local handicrafts, sewn from traditional materials in different designs and colours. She began this work as a machine operator and has 20 years of experience. She is asking for a loan to buy different types and colours of thread so she will be able to produce more fabrics. She hopes in the future to be able to employ workers.

loans.use: to buy thread for making knit goods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 42 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hijos de 15 y 24 años de edad; allí se dedica a la fabricación y venta de alimentos; sus principales productos son las hayacas: Amasijo de maíz, o arroz, relleno de verduras y carnes, envueltas en hojas de bijao;   oficio que aprendió por tradición familiar, pues en Ocaña un municipio de Norte de Santander,  vio desde muy niña como sus grupo familiar preparaba el delicioso producto, que Maria perfecciono con el tiempo, especialmente cuando emigró de su natal Ocaña en busca de oportunidades, hacia la Costa Caribe de Colombia. Cuando inició lo hizo con un pequeño capital, llevando productos de tienda en tienda en su barrio, muy pronto empezó a extenderse hacia las comunidades aledañas, donde por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios ha logrado concentrarse. Hoy quiere crecer aún más y ha escogido el mes de Diciembre, donde no solo las hayacas son compradas para venderlas, sino también para consumirlas directamente y esto es justamente lo que logrará impactar aún más sus ventas y con ello su crecimiento. Su sueño es lograr aumentar sus ingresos para continuar apoyando los estudios profesionales que iniciará su hija en el año 2012.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, para lograr descuentos, y tambien invertirá en una picadora, con la cual preparará sus hayacas de una manera más efectiva y dar respuesta oportuna a sus clientes, en estas alegres fiestas de fin de año, donde todos comparten comida y abundancia.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her partner and her children who are 15 and 24 years old. She prepares and sells food. Her main product is hayacas: a dough made of corn or rice, filled with vegetables and meat, and wrapped in banana leaves. She first learned through family tradition, in Ocaña a town north of Santander. She watched from the time she was a young girl at family gatherings the preparation of this delicious food, which Maria perfected over time, especially when she emigrated from her birthplace of Ocaña in search of opportunities toward the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

She began with little funding, carrying her products from store to store in her neighborhood. Very soon she began to fan out to surrounding communities focusing on the quality of her products and good prices.

Today she wants to expand even more and has chosen the month of December, because not only are the hayacas purchased for resale, but also for immediate consumption, so this is just what she will accomplish, the sales will increase and so will her growth.

Her dream is to increase her profit in order to be able to continue supporting her daughter and paying for the professional studies that she will begin in 2012. At this time she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first loan that will be made through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, in order to obtain discounts, and also to buy a chopper with which to prepare hayacas in a more effective way, and to meet the requests of her clients during these Happy New Year celebrations where everyone shares food and abundance.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, to receive a discount, and a chopper to use while preparing hayacas

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius wants another loan to purchase soap and sugar for resale in his retail shop. Aged 31 years, he started as a farmer. After accumulating enough savings, he set up a retail shop. His dream is to educate his children and start up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase soap and sugar for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles for wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future. The previous loan helped her improve her business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles for wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 27 años, es una mujer amable y muy buen, trabaja mucho ya que desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su menor hijo de 2 años, es conviviente con su pareja Ricardo quien tiene 40 años y con el trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante, vive en casa de sus padres ya que esta en proceso de comprar uno propio. El trabajo de Margarita consiste en el alquiler de una unidad de transporte de cuatro ruedas. Con el transcurrir del tiempo los ahorros que había guardado durante mucho tiempo, por fin tiene sus frutos, puesto que con ellos pudo comprar el carro que tanto ansiaba. Ahora a puesto a trabajar su vehículo como colectivo en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Gracias a esto sus ingresos han mejorado, ya que anteriormente percibía muy poco dinero de los trabajos eventuales que realizaba. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo como dueña del bus, es que le permite viajar constantemente y disfrutar de los paisajes, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida, sabe que es duro pero que a la larga le dará muy buenos resultados. Espera en el futuro pueda comprar otro carro y salir adelante trabajando de buena forma. Este será el crédito número 7 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará algunos repuestos y mandará al taller su vehículo para su revisión semestral.
texts.en:
27-year old Margarita is a good friendly woman who works hard as she wishes to provide a better standard of living for her young son who is two years old. She lives with her 40-year old husband Ricardo and together their goal is to get ahead in life. She lives in her parents’ house but is in the process of buying a place of her own.

Margarita earns her living by renting out her 4-wheeled vehicle. After a long time she had saved enough money to buy the car she had longed for. Now she runs it as a colectivo (shared taxi) in the town of Pucallpa. As a result her income has increased; beforehand she didn’t earn much money from the casual work she was doing.

Margarita really enjoys being the owner of a taxi as she can travel constantly and enjoy the countryside. She’s been doing this work for three years. The most difficult part for her is getting up very early in the morning in order to keep to the schedule. While the work is hard, she knows that in the long-term it will bring positive results.

In the future she would like to buy another vehicle and continue to make progress. This will be her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support to keep expanding her business. With the S/.1000 Margarita is seeking, she will buy spare parts and send her vehicle to the garage for its regular inspection.

loans.use: buy spare parts and have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her three children, ages 15 to 29.  They live in a small apartment, which she rents from others. One of her children attends the local high school, one attends the local university, and her elder daughter operates a small shoe selling business near their home. 

Since 2005, Tsogzolmaa has been operating a shoe selling business.  When she first began her business, she had no stall, but now she owns a small stall. She sells a wide range of shoes, which she imports from Ereen, a border city of China. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoes for the upcoming season. 

Also, she is one of our company’s trusted clients.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is a widow and has eight dependents. Ekua sells charcoal at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for four years. Ekua uses her income to cater for the children.

 Ekua will use the loan to  purchase firewood to produce  her charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her business, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 31 years, food kiosk owner at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of three who has been in this business for the last fifteen years doing well, and the husband gives her additional support.

This is her first borrowing to finance her business, she will use the money to  purchase cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves, sugar and the anticipated profit to open up a second business of firewood. She hopes to own a restaurant in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves, sugar

loans.name: Hortense

texts.en:
Mrs. Hortense D., born in 1975 in Lomé, is married and the mother of three (03) children. Her business is running a restaurant serving local specialties in the market of Bè, a popular district in Lomé. Her husband, a traveling photographer without a permanent job, can no longer meet all the needs of the family. Mrs. D., an ingenious woman, has put all of her know-how into her work and the idea of good hygiene, which means that everyone likes to eat in her restaurant. With such a large clientele, Mrs. D. cannot satsify everyone with her meager resources. That is why she is asking for a $500 credit to update the restaurant and build up a stock of the ingredients she uses in her business. This will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Hortense, née en 1975 à Lomé est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la restauration de mets locaux au marché de Bè, un quartier populaire de Lomé. Son mari, un photographe ambulant sans emploi fixe, n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous les besoins de la famille. Femme ingénieuse, elle met tout son savoir-faire dans son travail et a la notion de l’hygiène, ce qui fait que tout le monde aime restaurer chez elle. Devant cette clientèle, Madame D. n’arrive pas à les satisfaire par ses maigres moyens. Elle sollicite donc un crédit de $500 pour l’aménagement du lieu et faire un stock des denrées qui entrent dans son commerce. Ceci pour augmenter son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie d sa famille.

loans.use: Update the restaurant and build up a stock of ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to buy one dairy cow and animal feed to boost her cows' milk production

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en: M. Solmaz is 34, she is married and has 3 children. She has her small business raising some sheep. Now she is planning to broaden her business and buy one cow and one calf. She has applied for 1200 USD loan.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Fri

texts.en:
Fri is a wife and mother of five children. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management and experience in retailing raw food stuffs have led her to start a small food retail business.

In the past she was forced to borrow money to purchase goods because the wholesalers used to charge her exorbitant prices for buying on credit. With her current loan request of $100, she will be able to take advantage of the benefits of having liquidity and will probably earn enough profit to help change her life for the better. The first loan repayment installment will commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loans.use: Retailing of tomatoes and pepper

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Run was married in 1985 and has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. Since 2000, she has had a wholesale business selling firewood. She started this business with her husband's support. Her husband also helps her in the firewood business. He drives to the places to purchase the firewood from other villagers in the commune and other people.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA 3 times before now. She requests a loan of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase more firewood, so she can expand her business. She expects to have good sales during the upcoming flooding season.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood to sell to expand the business.

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen I. is 42 years old, and a married mother of 6 children.  She lives in Benin City.  She sells iron pots, plate, plastic and rubber in the villages market. She has been doing this since 1984 and has a member of LAPO for the past 4 years. She needs $400 to buy more pots, plates to sell.  She wishes to thank those who lend.

loans.use: To buy more iron pot, plate, cooler and plastic rubber for sale

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese a young mother in Faleapuna. This is her second loan from SPBD. Her business is sewing, and most of her clients are village people. Sometimes she earns a lot, especially when she sews a group's uniforms. She started her business in 2002 in a very small open house but now she has extended that and has a special room for her business. She earns $500 WST ($200 USD) in good days with the right customers. She set a goal for her business to move into Apia for a change. She never forgets the financial assistance from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and for home improvement

loans.name: Fuad's Bora Group

texts.en:
Fuad, age 36, is married with 3 children (ages 24, 18, and 12). She has a business of making and selling decorations, which she started in 2005. She works from 6am to 5pm daily, and in a month can make about $140 from this business.

In the past, Fuad has taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more stock. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Eva, a member in her loan group who has a hair salon business.

loans.use: To buy decoration stock

loans.name: Ulhanoy.

texts.ru:
Ulhanoy U. lives in the Rudaki region, she is 45 years old, is a widow and has 5 children. Ulhanoy has a high school education and works in agriculture. She will use her loan to purchase a dairy cow and will use the milk for her family and to sell to others. She has 10 years of experience in this area. This business helps her family and helps local residents to get fresh milk at affordable prices. Ulhanoy will pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Улоева Улханой Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 45 лет , вдова, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее занимается животноводством. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку дойной коровы, чтобы получать молоко как для своей семьи так и для продажи.Опыт работы в данной деятельности 10 лет.Этот бизнес помогает ее семье ,а также позволяет населению получать свежее молоко по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M., 45 years old, 4th year member of the TYM Fund, is married and has 6 children. She raises livestock and does business. She utilizes loans wisely and efficiently. The monthly family’s income is 200USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 450USD to buy piglets and to invest in her business. She wishes that she can remain her membership with Fund 10 or 15 more years.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị M., 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 6 người con. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là chăn nuôi và buôn bán. Các vòng vốn vay trước chị đều sử dụng đúng mục đích và hiệu quả. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 200USD/tháng. Thấy việc sử dụng vốn thuận lợi chị M. tiếp tục xin vay 450USD để mua lợn và buôn bán. Mong muốn của chị là sẽ tham gia Quỹ từ 10-15 năm nữa.

loans.use: Buy piglets and goods

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is 26 years old.  He has 1 child.  He works and lives with his family in Tyre, Southern Lebanon.  Adnan is a mechanic. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua.  He plans to use the loan to buy materials for his business.  He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: B. Matluba is 30 years old. She was born and lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. Mrs. B. Matluba has been raising livestock for 20 years, since she was a young girl and helped her mother. Now Mrs. B. Matluba is married and helps her husband with the animal care and milk making. She trades milk among the fellow villagers and at the local bazaar. Now Mrs. B. Matluba applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Mayas San Juan Group

texts.en:
The women of the Mayas San Juan community formed a new group of about two weeks of age and are looking to receive their first loan. Most of these women either own a weaving business or a daily consumption store. The women of this group know one and other quite well from their San Juan La Laguna community and expressed determination to prove themselves to their families, their group members, and their microlenders. They were content with being part of a community of “united women without envy of each other” as Cecilia C. V. put it.

There was consensus that the loans were going to be easy to repay. These loans would allow them primarily to invest in their business for higher future profit. Most women in the weaving industry create guipiles and cortes, the traditional indigenous outfits, to sell in the upcoming June 23rd town fair. Seven of them needed funds to invest in their stores which they hoped to set up near the fair. With more products to sell at once, their profits can be much larger during the peak sales of the festive season. They organized this meeting early precisely because of their hopes to receive their loans before the fair.

Melchora Isabel C. owns a traditional clothing store which focuses on sales to tourists. Thanks to her credit, she has been able to produce enough textiles to sell to an intermediary American friend, who exports to the USA. She hires friends to maintain her production rate and allow her time to continue to study in hopes of achieving the equivalent of a high-school degree.

She, along with five others of this new group, stood out as confident role models who began six years ago with loans of 40 USD and are now receiving loans of up to 400 USD. Most of them are in leadership positions such as group president or secretary. Iris Yolanda I. began without any business whatsoever, and is now the proud owner and manager of a crafts and textile business. Cecilia C. now travels to well-known Antigua, Guatemala, to sell the hammocks she makes in large amounts with the help of the loans.

The primary vision that these dedicated businesswomen share is to provide their children with the clothing, food, and education necessary for them to “have it better off than they did as children” and to go on into their adult life with a head start, as Cecilia C. expressed. Alicia C. Y. emphasized the need for this type of individual effort aided by the loans to collectively help their entire town, region, and soon country, prosper.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of market items. Purchase threads and dyes for weaving larger quantities at once.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 26 years old and the mother of two school-age sons. Thanks to the education and strong values that Elizabeth has taught them, her sons are intelligent and well-mannered. Her husband works in the river transportation business and supports Elizabeth in her business. For the past few years, Elizabeth has sold sweets, drinks and ice cream, as well as running a small car wash. Due to her charisma, Elizabeth has attracted a steady stream of customers. Now she would like improve her business, because of which she is requesting a loan. With your support Elizabeth will achieve her goal in no time.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth (26 años) es madre de 2 niños que aún están estudiando, gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que ella les imparte son unos muchachos muy listos y educados. Su esposo se dedica al transporte fluvial y apoya a Elizabeth en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas heladas y cuenta también con un pequeño lavadero de motos y autos desde hace ya tiempo, debido a su carisma cuanta con gran concurrencia de clientes. Ahora se encuentra en la necesidad de implementar su negocio, por ello que solicita D. dinero que pide en préstamo. Con tu apoyo la señora Elizabeth logrará pronto su objetivo.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati B., 40 years old, is a tailor in the village of Bhatkepati, Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago.  Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls.  She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs B. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from a training institution.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

She lives in a single family household with her husband and two children.  Both of her children are in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Kruoch

texts.en: This is the second time that Mrs. Kruoch D. has taken out a loan in order to improve her business. She is a rice middleman in Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Preap Sophal, is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. They have three children who are all attending school. Even though Mrs. Kruoch D. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their household. Thus, Mrs. Kruoch D. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings and buy a rice mill in order to start a new business. Previously, Mrs. Kruoch D. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport the rice that she buys from the villagers, and she has fully repaid it.

loans.use: To buy a rice mill

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia, es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la costura y a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Libertad  Nº 498. Los clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para remallar, telas de diferentes colores y calidades, también pagará la última letra de su máquina remalladota. Nimia confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también quiere invertir en perfumes, y desodorante, los cuales son los productos que más solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Nimia tiene 51 años de edad y es natural de Tarapoto. Su meta es implementar su taller con una vitrina y más máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Mrs Nimia is a member of the Credit Group In the Meantime "Las Perlitas" and lives in the Department and Province of San Martín, in the District of Tarapoto. For the last three years she has been dedicated to sewing and selling beauty products. Her conducts her business from her own home, located at Jr. Libertad Nº 498. Her customers are her neighbors and friends who live in the same city. With this loan of S/. 1,000 (approximately US $ 325) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of string and yarn to sew and knit fabrics of different colors and qualities, and to pay off the last installment of her sewing machine. Nimia makes clothing for women, men and children as well as investing in perfumes and deodorants, products that are most sought after by customers and which sell the quickets. Nimia is 51 years old and is a native of Tarapoto. Her dream is to open a workshop with a window and more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase string, yarn and fabrics. Payment for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nosirjon

texts.en: Nosirjon S. is 56 years old. He lives in the town of Isfara. He is married and has two children. His wife is a teacher at the local school. Nosirjon has been in the business of processing and selling dried apricots for 7 years. He also has his own orchard with 20 different types of apricot trees. Every year he makes dried apricots from his harvest. In addition, because of high demand for his products, he also purchases dried apricots form his supplier and sells them. Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of dried apricots for clients of different means. All this allows Nosirjon to make his business quite successful, and it brings a stable income for the family. Now, because of a high demand for his goods, he wants to buy more dried apricots. For this purpose, Nosirjon requests 2500 Somoni ($750) for a term of 5 months. Nosirjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To increase his stock of dried apricots

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal P. is a group leader of four people who live in Slaeng Village in Kandal Province.  

Mrs. Sophal P. is a farmer who has 1-hectar of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, she now faces a small problem because of her infertile soil.  In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.  Her husband, Mr. Bich Bo, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm wine and sugar.  

Mrs. Sophal P. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the one other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mehar Deen Muhammad Group

texts.en:
"I am Mehar and I’m a 58-year-old married lady. I reside in an area called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 30 years. My husband's name is D. M. and he is a watchman by profession. I am the mother of two sons.

"My elder son completed his education up to 8th standard and couldn’t study further because of lack of interest. He is working in a cotton factory where he fills cotton into sacks. My younger son got his education up to 10th standard and is working as a typist in the high court.

"I belong to a milk-selling profession. This is our family business. My mother was also involved in this business. I get milk from the buffalo by getting up early in the morning. Presently, I’ve one buffalo. I sell the milk in the milk shops and to the community as well. I sell the kg of milk at 34 Pak rupees. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand my milk-selling business.

"I’m the group leader for some more women from my locality. Razia baji and another lady called Razia baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. A third lady called Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to use to sew clothes."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
V. is a rice farmer and grows green beans to sell. She is 61 years old and has two children, both of whom are single (one is employed as a garment worker and one works growing rice with the family). The family is supported by one daughter whose income is around $60 per month for working as a garment worker.

V.'s husband is 68 years old and works with V.. After the rice farming season, she grows green beans to sell for another source of income and now the crop is growing but she faces difficulty getting water to supply her crop. With her green bean growing business, to improve efficiency, V. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a pump to irrigate her green bean crop and for farming rice. She expects the loan will improve their income by using the pump. V.'s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase a pump

loans.name: Chandeshsori

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandeshsori M. and her husband Mr. Keran M. are farmers in Khokhana, Nepal. They prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land because they do not have an irrigation system. They sell their vegetables in local markets in the morning and in the evening. Mrs. M. requests a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

Mrs. Chandeshsori M. lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two children in a village called Khokhana.  She has a son whose attending primary school and a daughter who is studying in grade 4.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa D. is a 37-year-old mother of four. She is married to a checker and bagger who works in the airport. Luisa is a barangay (township) councillor, a job which pays her some money. However, their combined income is not enough to support their family’s needs, so she also raises pigs to earn additional money.

She has applied for a loan to buy two piglets in order to establish a piggery in the future. She hopes to supply meat in their locality, a high quality meat she will produce out of the materials she will buy from her loan.

She dreams of building a better future for her children, by sending them to a university.

loans.use: To buy two pigs

loans.name: Marcia Elena

texts.es:
La venta de chinelas y sandalias es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Marcia L. en el mercado Central de la ciudad de León siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene su familia.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de las chinelas y por esto es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio de venta de chinelas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcia L. sells flip flops and sandals in the central market of León. This is the sole source of income to support her family. She needs to obtain funds to purchase flip flops and has come to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to get ahead in her business selling flip flops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth has owned a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 5 years. She belongs to the Semtema "A" west loan group (Group code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for resale, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Aneth is 38 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 8 and 1. She also cares for four additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale

loans.name: Edroze Grace Yose Group

texts.en: Mrs. Grace Y. is age 30, married, with six kids all going to school and one dependant. She has been selling vegetables, food like chapattis and madasi, beans, tomatoes, and silver fish for over ten years. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables, beans, tomatoes, silver fish, wheat flour, and cooking oil for making chapattis and madasi. Her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, silver fish and supplies for making chapattis etc.

loans.name: Octavian

texts.en:
This is Octavian and he has run businesses for many years. As a beginning entrepreneur, he wants to increase his stock of goods. Octavian wants to purchase seeds and build a greenhouse for cultivation. Microinvest has granted him a loan to buy the necessary wood and plastic sheeting for the greenhouse. In the future, Octavian would like to increase the number of cattle he owns by borrowing another loan from Microinvest. This will happen after he repays his current loan.

We wish him good luck and hope his business is a success.

loans.use: To purchase wood and plastic sheeting for a greenhouse

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
O. Moses is 28 years old. He is a married man blessed with three children, two of whom are schooling. He takes care of his mother with him in his family.

Moses has a retail shop, which he has been operating for over four years. Moses will use this loan to increase his retail stock of sugar, soap, salt, tea leaves, rice, maize flour, millet flour, pet coats, biscuits, etc. He had run short of stock because of his construction process: he used his capital to purchase windows, doors, and cement for completing his house. Now he is restoring the capital with this loan. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to create a firm foundation for his children’s education.

loans.use: To restock his retail store

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
M. Marie Chantal is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali City, the capital of Rwanda. She and her husband have five children of the following ages: 13, 11, 9, 7, 5 years old.

Chantal operates her business in Kabeza sector where she owns a stall where she sells paints and hardware supplies. She has a great deal of experience from nine years in this business and she has a monthly profit of $165. She starts her daily business at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m. She has three regular workers.

Her first loan was 521,075 RWF. Now she is seeking her second loan worth 600,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With this loan she will buy more products for her hardware stall and she will reinvest the increased profit in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more hardware supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (646991190) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two adult children.

M. owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en:
Margaret is a forty-three-year-old woman. She is married with four children and all her four children are in school through support from government compulsory education.

Margaret is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Margaret wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her first child entering university. With the loan support she would like to increase savings to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Rufiza

texts.en:
S. Rufiza is 31 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband (pictured) has the business of processing of the wheat and in order to support her spouse Rufiza for more than 4 years dedicates herself to raising livestock. Her earnings have helped her to purchase more animals to raise, which she does over a period of 4 years. At one month’s time, she sells them at the Sunday market. Now she decided to request a loan of $ 1000 USD to purchase young cattle and fodder for them. Rufiza is very content with her work because, together with her husband, she carries out her enterprise and her dream is providing an education for her children.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the young cattle

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
“Progress in life depends on how you carry out your duties and responsibilities in life,” says Antonia T. of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is happily married to Jaime Ernesto T. and they are blessed with six children: four boys and two girls. Two of the children have graduated from college, while some of the others did not pursue studies in college because they got married at an early age. Their youngest is presently studying in college.

Antonia's husband works as a laborer in their village, and sometimes he uses their motor vehicle for transport services to help her generate a higher income to meet their daily needs and support the education of their youngest child. Antonia (called "Inday") manages a general store business where she sells a variety of commodities, vegetables and some other products. She wants a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional business capital, so that she can further improve her store. According to her, “Patience is the key to success,” thus, she works very hard for the welfare of her family and has a good business. She hopes that she can improve her business and earn a higher income with the financial help of Kiva.

loans.use: Additional capital for a store
